author: ShatteredGlass33
review: So far much better then I expected. The game play is constantly evolving and once I think I have explored an area I notice something new, then I realize how huge the world is and I am instantly in shock. The side quests are amazing and engaging so far, the main story is well thought out and very original so far. 6.9 hours in I feel like I have barely seen 1% of what this game has to offer. A few small game glitches so far but nothing game breaking or that breaks the immersion for more then a split second. So far 8.5/10, polished, well thought out, amazing game so far.  (NOTE: I bought the deluxe edition and I  have not made it far enough in game to unlock deluxe edition exclusive content, this review was solely on the base game content so far) GPUs/graphic comments: I am running on 1080p Ultra Graphics setting (no ray tracing enabled (yet) and I am currently using a RX 6700 XT eagle and have has no issues, for those with an older graphics card I also tested it briefly on my old RX 580 8 GB and was able to get 45 FPSish on medium/low I recommend a 6700XT or better for ultra but an older card can swing medium/low it if you don't mind poorer graphics )

author: Loot Lord
review: Game has a good main quest story line with a beautiful world that u want to explore ASAP. Once you're out there, you realise how dull and repetitive it all gets. There's no point in exploring and doing dungeons since what you get is nothing but a same clothes or coins you get in every random crate around the villages corner. Nearly all spells are boring and most of them you won't be using. There are like what...8 types of monsters/enemies and most of them are just annoying to fight against and knowing that the loot they drop is also coins or their remains that you most likely won't be using. There are still a lot of things i could continue to talk about, but it's pointless since there are other people that feel the same like me and already wrote a review. Basically the amount of content they could've added was HUGE, but this what we ended up with.

author: Tsuyu Aihara
review: Se você curte o universo criado pela J.K Rowling, esse é o jogo! Eu adorei o jogo.Vale 250 conto? Se você gosta de Harry Potter, sim. Ele é quase tudo que um fã queria.Porém, se nunca se importou em ler os livros, ou ver os filmes, eu recomendo esperar promo.Em questão de gameplay, é divertido, e os puzzles são bem legais.A main quest é decente, não é ruim, é bem legalzinha, mas não tem nada de grandioso também, é bem simples, já falo isso, porque hoje em dia você tem aquele povo que quer que todo jogo seja um Silent Hill 2 ou Elden Ring com 200 de QI em roteiro, povo chato pra caramba.As side-quests do seus colegas segue no mesmo pique.Enfim, eu dou um 8 para o jogo, da pra se divertir muito.

author: Oskej
review: We should start with the biggest issues I have, finishing at some minor inconveniences.The world of Harry Potter and Hogwarts Legacy has the benefit of the real world essentially creating endless possibilities to warp it and change at will fitting the fantasy world of wizards and witches endlessly trying not to bring muggles into their business. This alone should be enough to make one hell of a universe… universe that Hogwarts Legacy barely expands on, that Harry Potter movies altered to bare minimum, enough to make couple of movies out of it. The thing is, videogame is not a movie, and it requires quite a lot more work to create believable, enjoyable and well put together world that does not need explanation outside of environmental storytelling on its own.Second most visible and painful problem is the checklist well known from Ubisoft productions like Assassins Creed, so called fillers that they’re giving players to sink hours into completion that has nothing of value, but cosmetics, upgrades, craftables. Hogwarts Legacy has quite a lot of them, and I can only assume that they were made purely to fit the popular world designs of triple A games that we were fed for past couple of years. Once you try any of those collectables once, all of them work pretty much the same, and there’s way more than enough of them to give you a headache, especially if you’re a completionist.What also stands out is that every cave has exactly the same design, every bandit camp is the same thing, and there is simply not enough unique locations to do something better with it.I should put it in the first place, but considering that game with mute protagonist and NPCs that you can talk not even once to in order to complete the game, it lands on third place, just because it exists in this game and it is beyond annoying.Most of the characters are boring, and their dialogue is something you would see more in a parody of Harry Potter more than actual and serious game.Side-quest dialogue is stiff, and feels like not enough budget was put into minor background characters, while everything was pumped into cutscenes including characters vital to the main story. Considering that I did not finish the game yet, and I’m probably not even halfway through it I can’t really have an opinion on main story, but so far every single side quests I completed was just a simple fetch, kill, gather quest that also feels like a filler, in addition to world design issues I stated earlier. I believe there are some quests that are interesting, but I am yet to complete them.Nearly non existing. This one is essentially dropped from Avalanches to do list. You can spin the globe, pet the cat, have some beasts, whatever. Interactions with what matters are not there. You can get one liners from some students in the castle. Every interaction that starts the quest is something you would expect current AI robots to do. It is not believable. Characters just stand waiting for you to approach them, do your thing, come back and then never interact with them again. For a videogame following this design you would expect to find characters asking for help midway through the thing they ask you to do, not just stand and wait for their savior. If you take into consideration games like Red Dead Redemption 2, Hogwarts Legacy is 10 steps back in terms of interactivity with the world. I will not mention the whole ‘choice matters’ thing, because there is no choice to nothing. The most important to me, certainly not to others.I will start by saying that designs in this game are wonderful. Ambience and aesthetics of the castles interior are on par with Elden Rings.The problem starts when you’re getting bored of the castle and you want to explore outside of it, because… there is not a lot to explore. If you take the checklist locations you’re really left with couple of places that shine the most. I think that while with real life locations, such as Hogwarts being in UK, worldbuilding gets the most opportunities to shine, while world design can get tricky to pull off, and you can clearly see that just flying around the map. Couple of extraordinary locations on a simple map with just mountains and plains is something that Horizon Zero Dawn was suffering from, and it is a shame.

author: Kilroy
review: Or Hogwarts Legacy is an open world game set in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, about 100 years prior to Harry Potter's time, making knowledge of the Harry Potter universe helpful, but it does not provide you with insight into the story.You are starting at Hogwarts as a fifth year student. Since you have missed the first four years you are assigned a mentor to bring you up to speed on what you will need to know. On your way to Hogwarts, you take a flying carriage, not the train. You find that you can see ancient magic. Then your party is attacked by a dragon. You escape using a port key that lands you in Gringots…and then things start to get interesting.Hogwarts Legacy is an open world game set in the wizarding world of Harry Potter, about 100 years prior to Harry's birth. This means that while knowing the Harry Potter lore is helpful, but not essential. You start off by creating your character. Your appearance can be either male or female. The game does have a number of NPCs with same sex relationships, if that bothers you.One thing the diehard fan will have issues with is the fast travel floo system. This is due to a number of things, you require floo powder to use the floo system and the floo system connects chimneys. Once you get out of Hogwarts and Hogsmeade the floo system connections are frequently attached to fireplaces, but not the whole system. However you don't need to be near a floo end point to use the floo system, you can use it anywhere in the game, except for the few times it is locked out due to the story or if you're inside an instance.You will have to complete tasks so that the professors will teach you additional spells. To learn a spell you have to follow a path pressing certain keys or buttons to increase the speed of your token. Fortunately you only need to do this one time as the game would be quite difficult if you had to do it during combat. After you learn a spell you can pin it to your spell bar. The spell bar holds four spells and you can have access to up to four spell bars. The only spell this does not hold true for is the spell to open locks, you must play a mini game every time. The mini game is not difficult, but it is rather annoying when you're doing it for the 40th time.Combat is hard. Especially since you are normally outnumbered, you versus however many enemies there are. You are taught this early on in the dueling club. Where you are given the option to fight with a friend. Foolishly I thought that not having the friend would make it a fair fight, nope same fight with no help, or something else for them to shoot at. As you progress through the game enemies will protect themselves with different protections which require a specific spell class to break, and you only have four to work with. I played with a keyboard and mouse, I do not know if a gamepad would be easier or harder. Later on it was easier for me as my keyboard allows me to create macro keys, so I can easily switch between a larger variety of spells. The problem is that with so many spells you have a choice of cast or move, you can't do both with a keyboard and mouse.The graphics are beautiful, you feel like you're living in a movie. The world is huge. You are not simply stuck in Hogwarts and Hogsmeade. You have the surrounding villages and countryside to explore.Every launch the game has to prepare the shaders, depending on your computer this make be quick, 30 seconds to a minute for me, or longer.There is plenty to do in the game. Collect gear, better gear means you'll have an easier time of things. You can upgrade your gear by adding additional traits to it. You have your standard quests and lots of side quests. There are five different categories of challenges: combat, quests, exploration, field guide pages, and room of requirement. In side of the different challenge categories are a number of different challenge types. As you complete challenges you will gain additional gear, appearances, and upgrades.You can do everything a wizard does. Grow magical plants to fight for you or as potion ingredients. Collect and breed magical creatures who will supply you with the things you will need to upgrade and enchant your gear.As you level you will earn talent points that you can use to customize your character to suit your play style.The more I played this game the more it struck me as an MMO, without other people. Tons of things to do, with a lot of variety.Intel i7-8086K Coffee Lake 6-Core 4.00GHz CPUCrucial Ballistix Sport AT 2666 MHz DDR4 RAM (16GB x 2)ASUS GeForce RTX 2080 Overclocked 8G GDDR6Or

review: This game is wide, but shallow as hell. I dont get the experience of studying in a school, but only playing a normal Open World game with magic school as the background.There is no routine in this school, you dont take class unless the quest asks you to; you only sleep on the floor when waiting for someone; you dont eat food; you dont actually make friends at your own will (collect different teammates will be so much fun); there is no actual difference or competition between colleges.Everything is making this game non-immersive. author: mr_gamezombie
review: I'm not a big fan of the Harry Potter novels or films, however, the game is fantastic. You can tell there has been a lot of care put into the world and game design. The gameplay is interesting with fun puzzles to take up your time plus a refreshing take on wand/magic combat. I highly recommend the game.

author: Rhyfelwr
review: I am not a fan of Harry Potter at all, I saw the movies ages ago but that’s it.However…The game is simply amazing! One of the best AAA games in the past decade. It’s just so much fun!What I like:- Excellent snappy combat- Gorgeous graphics, truly next gen. (for a price)- Interesting quests (there are fetch quests but they are short and sweet)- Main Story so far is entertaining, much like a HP spinoff movie.- Loads of content (10 hours in, barely scratched the surface)- Great characters and voice acting.- Exploration is unparallelled, you never know what you find in the next nook, pretty much all doors are open, the castle is GIGANTIC, and that is only part of the map.- An amazing collect-a-thon! I loathe collectibles (looking at you Assassins Creed) but Hogwarts somehow makes it fun and rewarding.What I don’t like:- Awful PC performance, especially if you want to use Ray-Tracing (my RTX 4070ti struggles on ultra)- Controls are clunky at times. Not the worst console port in that regard though.- Some QoL issues and gripes.- Underutilised house quarters, perhaps there could be a tiny bit more interaction with the world (eat, sleep, wait, maybe minigames)- Underwhelming gear and loot, feels pretty much as Cyberpunk 2077, you just swap out gear for the highest number one and toss the rest. (huge missed opportunity there)Overall the game is a 9/10 for me, truly next-gen and a labour of love. Also for a huge open world RPG it is relatively bug-free too. Performance is bad, but there is DLSS and graphics can be toned down. I am willing to look past that though, because the game does live up to the hype!

author: krishtian
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a highly anticipated open world action/adventure RPG game about wizards and witchcrafts in well-known universe as classic "Harry Potter" series of J.K. Rowling books.  The story takes place in 19th century where you start your journey as a student of 5th year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The story begins on your way to your first day at school and the sorting hat ceremony. The wizarding world is in a threat of a powerful Goblin, Ranrok. Throughout our academy year we would need to combine both study during our classes and exploration of the found portkey and what's behind that.Unfrotunately, to fully enjoy the world of Hogwarts you need to have a decent specs PC. Outstanding visuals, modern technologies such as ray-traycing, DLSS, FSR etc. Breathtaking world and school itself developed to the smallest details from what you've seen through the movies.Music that reminds you all the movies from "Harry Potter" and "Fantastic Beasts and where to find them" won't leave you indifferent. Voice acting is another piece that will make you drown in this magical world. Though, not recommended to move your voice tone from default, otherwise that might sound a bit "robotic".That's exactly what every fan has been dreaming about. Learn unique spells and combain them so you can beat every single enemy as they have it's unique strategy to defeat. Fly on the broom or mistic creatures from the universe. Customize your character the way you see it and your point skills the way you want.Is it a masterpiece? Yes, it is. This game is dedicated to every fan of "Harry Potter" but also to those who is in love with RPG games like "Witcher 3" with interesting side quests and world to explore.- Customizable characters- Intriguing main story- Music and audio effects to satisfy every fan of the universe- Attention to small details- 30 hours of pure gamplay to beat the main story and extra 50 to explore the world- Demanding PC- No Quidditch game- No steam cards/items

author: Digitalvampster
review: An absolute gem of a game! Game runs great on Steam Deck at 40FPS Med-High Settings, using a few Cryo-utilities changes with Vram/Swap Files. Docked is a steady 30FPS with a 720p-1080p Tv. Pre-release there where a few minor frame drops in cut scenes, but as of the 10th I no longer notice them! Come join the Hogwarts Hype Train!

author: CAMEEEEEEEEEE
review: , only wrote a novel about a young wizard named Harry Potter, but it has now grown in size and is one of the most recognizable and profitable brands in the World.The secret of the Harry Potter novels is hidden in the heart of each of the readers, young and old, is a symbiosis of imagination and logic, a passion for adventure and romanticization of the environment, recognition of realism and comparison of its characters with oneself. Simply put, the Harry Potter novels are accessible to the understanding of most people, have a mass sign, however, unlike many one-day books, they have a deep foundation of myths and fairy tales, closely intertwined with the real situation of the developing World (although these political, social and other aspects will be more accessible to adult readers than to younger fans of the book series)./, лишь написала роман о юном волшебнике по имени Гарри Поттере, но в настоящее время это выросло в размерах и является одним из самых узнаваемых и окупаемых брэндов Мира.Секрет романов о Гарри Поттере скрыт в сердце каждого из читателей, от мала до велика, – это симбиоз воображения и логики, страсти к приключениям и романтизации окружающего, узнавание реализма и сопоставление его персонажей с самим собой. Проще говоря, романы о Гарри Поттере доступны пониманию большинства людей, имеет массовый признак, однако, в отличие от многих книг-однодневок, имеет под собой глубинный фундамент мифов и сказок, тесно переплетающийся с реальной обстановкой развивающегося Мира (правда, эти политические, социальные и прочие аспекты будут более доступны взрослым читателям, нежели младшим поклонникам серии книг). is an immersive fantasy RPG set in a beautiful open world with stunning scenery, charismatic and memorable characters, a fantastic combat system and tons of mechanics. This game is not only for fans of the Harry Potter universe, but simply a wonderful game in itself. Avalanche Software did something really special with Hogwarts Legacy, and it justifies the hype. At the very least, it sets a solid foundation for future Magic world games. And we can safely say that this is the best thing that has happened in the franchise since the original books and movies./ — это захватывающая фэнтезийная RPG в красивом открытом мире с потрясающими пейзажами, харизматичными и запоминающимися персонажами, а также фантастической боевой системой и целой массой механик. Это игра не только для поклонников вселенной Гарри Поттера, но и попросту замечательная игра сама по себе. Avalanche Software сделала нечто действительно особенное с Hogwarts Legacy, и это оправдывает возникший ажиотаж. Она как минимум создает прочную основу для будущих игр в Волшебном мире. И мы можем с уверенностью сказать, что это лучшее, что было во франшизе со времен оригинальных книг и фильмов.

author: Neco the Sergal
review: Not a Harry Potter fan in any sense but the gameplay always looked good when shown so I decided to give it a try. At launch its a bit rough around the edges but the game definitely has potential of being the best game no doubt for the franchise. Fans should be excited for this cause even being a non-fan, I can enjoy the world, its got the charm of the movies in them, a bit too PG-friendly dialogue for my taste but its not so subdued of violence that it gets boring.Combat is comparable to Batman Arkham games, some depth but easy to master.The games world is pretty huge, the Hogwarts Castle is MASSIVE, and it'd not shock me if the game operated like CDPR's Witcher series where expansions or content drops can expand the areas or world to explore more areas once more development happens.People who Spite-Bought this to help the devs or who got it to simply counter the more obnoxious individuals who exist in society will have the ability to actually play and enjoy the game rather than let it sit there unplayed. Lots of things to do and to explore.I hope the games success will make the developers able to make more games of this quality and improve further and give us even better games down the road that's different from their typical/average releases (As wikipedia would show what they were doing before this game).Troll the insufferable and insecure cyber-bullies to your hearts content.

author: Just Chill
review: I just love this game.But to be fair, I either love the franchise.However, as it's published by WB Games, there are quite the paralells...Similar to Mad Max, Batman or Shadow of Mordor / War (all published by WB Games), it has tons of useless collectibles and sideactivities, that get repetitive over time.If you are no fan of the magical world created by J. K. Rowling, it might be not your cup of tea.The story is either not very lush, but then there is Sebastians side quest. ^^What this game does pretty well is giving an immersive open-world with a beautiful atmosphere.The performance has some issues here and there, but at least I had no single crash yet within 99 hrs of play.Currently brooming around with my second char, who is a girl in Slytherin (the guy before was a Ravenclaw).And despite of knowing the formula from previous WB Games as written above, their beautifully crafted worlds often motivates me to get out the most of these games.As it is with this one! :D

author: RPG Gamer Man
review: NOTE: This review was done on Version Build 1121649.Hello friends! Welcome to my review of Hogwarts Legacy.Alot of real life people arguing about this game and causing a big mess. In my opinion, if you want to just play the game and ignore the real life jank, then do it. You do not need to follow what everyone else says, do your own thing. Now that i got out of the way, let me talk about this game. The game revolves around the world of Harry Potter and the Wizarding World. Harry Potter is not in this game, but it is in the same place he attended wizard school in the movies. The game takes place in the past around the 1800's, the turn of the century. Alot of things in harry potter movies are somewhat different in this game. Also, you can explore various locations around the wizarding world, including scotland and hogsmeade. Many of the spells from the movies are also in the game, and you can learn them throught the year. The game itself is pretty open ended and you can even explore and put the main quests on hold until later. Be aware that some places will not be accessible until you learn certain spells. This will block where and how far you can explore. The season also changes the further you go into the story.The game is also open world, like a ubisoft title game. There are also collectibles hidden around the world you can find. These will take some time to find if you plan on trying to find them. The game is not perfect. It does have some bugs in it, and the developers are currently fixing it still at this point. This means it could improve from what it is right now. Anyways, the following is my PRO/CON list:PROS:- A open world game in the wizard world of harry potter. If your a fan of the movies, you may want to play this game.- Collectibles around a open world.- Side quests.- Ability to learn new spells thought the year.- The first game in more than 10 years where it is linked to the wizarding world.- Easter eggs in the game that link them to the harry potter movies, including a quiz by a npc.CONS:- There are some bugs that can mess with collecting items in the game. It can cause errors on the map in the game. I experirenced a issue where it showed a field page i collected, but never disappeared off the map.- Repetition of the game is a big problem. If you do not want to do it, take a break and then come back to play it some other time.- The open world seems too open at some points and wish to have more things to do in it.- Many places you explore look similiar, especially the treasure vaults.- Some people are complaining about stutters or other issues, but i hardly had any and im on a 3060 graphics card. Make sure to set benchmark in the game to get graphic settings correctly.Do i recommend the game? Yes, because the last harry potter game i played was lego harry potter series on ps2, and really missed the games. In the end, it is whether you have fun with the game if your a fan of the movies or not.

author: N7 Andy
review: I absolutely do not regret buying the Deluxe Edition for that sweet early access. What a fantastic game! It's so nice to see a huge open-world banger of this scale launch so well, for once... (at least from my experience, so far!) ... As someone who grew up with Harry Potter, watched all the movies a few dozen times each and read all the books in 2 different languages, I get goosebumps every time I launch the game! :')I feel like Hogwarts Legacy is a nice open-world experience. The open-world interactivity is quite surprising, really. There are a lot of much bigger budget AAA titles out there (looking at you, Cyberpunk 2077, my old friend!) that would really benefit from the Hogwarts Legacy open-world treatment, where random items can be interacted with, which play their own unique set of animations, such as picking up food / drink from stalls and consuming them, brewing potions in real time, etc... those classic, 'old-school' immersive sim elements that seem to be dying more and more with each new AAA release where quantity is favoured over quality.Hogwarts Legacy is also a game I like to 'taste' ... to take in really slow. After 50 hours, only now did I receive my broom stick. Most people would have received their broom in the first 10 hours or so... The game has finally opened up in all its glory, to me. It feels like the fun has only just begun. As I am a completionist, I see a good 200 hours of gameplay per playthrough. Currently, I'm a Gryffindor according to the online Wizarding World Quiz!The combat slaps, too! xD It's quite addicting, it works so well, and the different combos that can be pulled off by mixing and matching spells feel super rewarding. The game might be aimed at 12+ , but it actually has a pretty complex, deep and rhythmic system if you don't spam the same buttons all the time!

author: BadHairDayVibes
review: TLDR: It's a decent game, the story is alright, but it's filled to the brim with cutscenes and dialog, tons of "fetch" quests. About 25-30 hours of main story, which goes by quickly. I'm not impressed by the graphics whatsoever, and I still suffer a lot with lag spikes and glitches, even tho I have a decent computer. Detailed Review: The main story gets sorta boring quite quick, it's a lot of "get this for me" or "speak with" quests. Feels a lot like filler, rather than actual main stuff. Getting side quests and main story mixed up, is really easy. Combat is fun in the beginning, but as time goes, it gets monotonous, and it's about 60% of the game. The finale boss battle is probably the best one, yet unbelievable tedious. Dialog and cutscenes take up A LOT of the game, which isn't an issue for me normally, but it drags out in Hogwarts Legacy. You can't really pick up any quests without having to go through 1-5 minutes dialog or a cutscenes of sorts. Which also counts for the side quests, or the many extra things to do, such as the Merlin Challenges. Something I really enjoy is spending time with magical beasts, it's dull, but enjoyable and generally working on the Room of Requirement, is really relaxing - once you've collected everything. Colleting can be a big part of the game, It's not necessary whatsoever, but it's a good break from questions. If you're expecting some connections between Harry Potter and Hogwarts Legacy, dont buy the game. There's a few similarities and Easter eggs, but not nearly enough for buying it. And no, theres no option of any "romance" in the game. None. So don't buy it for that either. My biggest "issue" with the game is, how bad it is to play on PC. Even after a few updates and patches, I'm still suffering with a lot of lag spikes, map glitches and delayed gameplay. I have a pretty solid gaming computer, that runs most games. Not Hogwarts Legacy tho, not even on low or medium settings.

author: Purzel2205 🎀🍫🔪
review: The hate the development studio and many of the games players have to endure is a classic case of the revolution devouring its own children, considering how the developers actively tried to distance themselves from the author and even included a trans character in the game.I hope at least some of the people who got burned just by being associated with this game will have some second thoughts about blindly supporting these internet activist people who labeled them supporters of "trans genocide" in the future.

author: nika.firebird
review: What a game! I generally don't write reviews before I finish the games, but want to make an exception. Firstly, it is absolutely gorgeous and is filled with a myriad of tiny little details that make up the whole atmosphere of the world. There are these amazing gargoyles that always say the funniest stuff as you dash past them, or suits of armor with their quirks (don't want to say more, because it's fun to discover all of these on your own). Apart from stunning views, the clothes look really well-made, the textures are great on anything (apart from maybe faces).The gameplay is A LOT OF fun. Whether it is puzzles, mini games or combat, it all feels smooth, polishes and a lot of fun, just like it should be. I have only encountered one bug, when the game crashed, but other than that, nothing game-breaking. For the first time in  recent years I felt like a bought a whole product, and not a half-assed unfinished mess. Absolutely love the game, and have a feeling it will be in the top of my all time favourites for a very very long time.

author: Zabata
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a fantastic addition to the world of Harry Potter. The game truly captures the magic and excitement of attending the prestigious Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The attention to detail in recreating the iconic school is astonishing, and players will feel like they are really part of the world. The combat system is engaging, and the progression system is deep, allowing players to tailor their character to their own playstyle. Although there may be some open-world padding, it is outweighed by the overall enjoyable experience. If you're a fan of Harry Potter universe, Hogwarts Legacy is a must-play.

author: ART3M!X
review: And in the end, Hogwarts' real legacy was getting to see the stupid look on the faces of all who tried to cancel this game but failed miserably.

author: Dr Lady Baeben
review: Fixio my graphicso

author: F.Cook
review: Bought because JK Rowling is unfathomably based

author: Hyaki
review: Ok game but not worth the price

author: ✤M A Y A✤
review: This is the game I have been waiting for. It feels like playing first time skyrim. So many quest and lore to accomplish.  It's gonna be great adventure.PS: I am not fan of harry potter series.

author: Kitsunei
review: Best game i`ve ever played. Just need to add quidditch then it`d be *chefs kiss*.

author: aeka
review: “Why so Sirius?”A blind wizard walks into a bar, finds his way to a stool, and sits down.He says rather loudly to the barkeep,“Hey, how would you like to hear a Hufflepuff joke?”The bar goes silent and the barkeep replies,“Sir, I will not lie to you. You are speaking to a Hufflepuff.The man behind you is an Auror from Hufflepuff, the woman to your right is a Hufflepuff dueling champion, and we all have our wands drawn.Do you really want to continue?”The blind wizard goes silent for a moment before curtly replying,“No I don’t. Not if I’m going to have to explain it three times.”

author: tramphoeline
review: I genuinely cannot stress enough how in love with this game I am, and I have barely scratched the surface despite having played for hours.This game has personified the castle and has done so in a way that practically screams the perfect home for witchcraft and wizardry. The game is incredibly beautiful and has brought every page of the books to life. It is both imaginative and creative and has been so very well done that I have been pretty much awestruck each time I've entered a new room. From the 'Kings Cross' to the cherry blossom in the greenroom observatory, you're taken on a journey that I truly don't want to end. Although the castle has been one of the highlights of this game, it's important to note that there is SO MUCH more to it.The map itself is huge and comes with a lot of detail and challenges. There are a lot of side quests, and its a game you really do need to grind to get anywhere. There's a good mix of enemies and it puts your skill to the test. I like that you contribute to your combat inventory rather than buying items at shops - i.e. the mixing and making of potions. I also like that each store is different, so you're not guaranteed the items you need, forcing you to explore the map a bit more.The game-play itself is fantastic. It is easily adaptable for anyone wanting to start playing but is not used to this style of game and has a fairly simple structure that can be learned quickly. If I could compare the mechanics and interface of this game, I'd say it comes pretty close to God of War for me (don't come for me about this because I do not care).Basically, if you've played God of War, you'll have a good understanding of the inventory, skills, and other features of this game and its layout because they feel similar, making it easier and more appealing. I would even say that smaller collectibles challenges also have a small resemblance to GoW (think the 10 mask artifacts, nornir chests, etc), but it feels subtle enough that I'm possibly one of the few people who feel this way.The customisation of characters is decent but please do not play it expecting to have an exact replica of yourself. This is not Sims. There is a good range of skin-tones, faces, and colours to choose from for hair/eyes, though it's not as important as you'd think as most of the game is spent looking at the back of your own head unless in a cut scene.So far the storyline is great and not what I expected which is even better. I am currently spending more of my time exploring and collecting as I am a treasure goblin that needs to collect things before I move on, however, so far it has been nothing short of great. I love that you can walk around freely, and that you can skip conversations, both great features. The music score is also really well done. I enjoy the idle exploration music which can bounce between sonatas, adding to the ambience.I have had a couple of issues with FPS drops, but overall it's not too bad and it doesn't last long, usually a couple seconds here and there. My specs are: AMD Ryzen 5 5600x 6-Core, 32GB, RTX 3070.Overall, if you're sitting on the fence about getting this game, I'd highly recommend you do. A lot of the time, hype trains do not live up to their expectation, but this has exceeded mine.10/10UPDATE: I have now clocked the game and have gotten all Steam achievements. For anyone who is grinding, it's a good challenge - difficult, but not overly hard, and the map indicates where you're missing things which is incredibly helpful. I enjoyed the little missions and the different places the game took me to, I especially liked seeing all of the common rooms. Without a DOUBT, Slytherin stays on top.Again, 200% recommend. I will be doing a second full play through as a male character - I have to admit, the female characters got done dirty, so I will only play as a male for the rest of my games, they look way better in outfits (and that's all I really ever grind for - outfits and trinkets).Enjoy the game!

author: BASKHD
review: Bought this game so I can be a certified transphobe but the game doesn't even have any transphobic or anti-semitic content. I am very disappointed in this game. Also the game had british people (why?).

author: -Eq-reNyYyYyYyYyYyY
review: This game is a masterpiece, visually and musically. Full of magic, full of fantasy. The views are majestic, the game is worth purchasing and never gets boring. It's a stunning way to experience Hogwarts. EXPELLIARMUS!

author: Lumin
review: "Character Creation Review - Hogwarts Legacy features some great, yet curated, Harry Potter style customization options with fantastic visuals for your witch or wizard. Awesome hair, too!"Hogwarts Legacy offers players the opportunity to jump into the magical world of Harry Potter and create the perfect witch, or wizard, of their dreams with a decent set of curated presets, a good selection of character customization options, fitting styles suited to the wand slinging you are no doubt going to do, and honestly some of the best hair I have seen in a video game to date. While you don't get direct control over the sculpting of the features of your characters face, or body, the game offers enough choices to allow for some pretty unique and interesting characters regardless. The skin colors also don't, for some reason, offer very many lighter or paler options... although this may just be a trick of the lighting in character creation. The detail of the character model, and I assume the rest of the game as well, is also quite impressive and the visuals are an absolute treat. The character creation system does funnel you into a specific style which I believe makes total sense given both the world you are jumping into and the role you are assuming in the story being told. As for the specifics there are, as mentioned, a lot of great presets to pick from, both male and female body types, face shapes, skin color choices, a few starter pieces of eyewear, a massive selection of hair styles, textures, and colors that look absolutely fantastic, no facial hair (which kind of makes sense), some complexion and skin options, eye and eyebrow customization, and finally two voices with control of their pitch. (The pitch doesn't really work all that well as of right now) You also get to pick whether you are adressed as a witch or a wizard.That's it! Overall I am quite impressed by the lot of it and had a blast going through all the options. You can find my full character creation video linked below for my reactions and all the rest. Remember to use the timestamps to jump to what you want to see. Enjoy!

author: Starfy
review: Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs, I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!Here are the ingredients you will need!Ravioli Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 pinch salt, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 tablespoons water.Ravioli Filling: 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese, 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup provolone cheese, shredded, 1 egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.Pesto-Alfredo Cream Sauce: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce, 2 cups heavy cream, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil, 2 eggs, and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand; use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth, 8 to 10 minutes; add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.3. While the dough is resting, prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese, egg, and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream, raise the heat to high, and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.5. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, warm the marinara sauce over medium-low heat.6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli, brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta, pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli, and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot, 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown, about 4 minutes.10. To serve the ravioli, divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.

author: McGorgeous
review: The game looks great, it's very immersive and well taught. Only con I have so far is the revelio mechanic is rather tedious when searching for Field Guide Pages.

author: Queen
review: I have not followed the development of this game, I read the books and watched the movies, which I enjoyed, but I am not that big of a HP fan. I liked the universe, but I was not sure about getting the game, since majority of the games released in the last few years were unfinished and/or in a ridiculous state. I got the game as a gift and after 30 hours into the game, I have to say, it is much more incredible than I have ever hoped for in my wildest dreams. Hardly found any bugs and all of those were only visual. The world is HUGE, gorgeous, detailed and you have tons of things to do and collect. The atmosphere is incredible and I cannot praise this game enough. The amount of love and care this game received is enormous. Thank you so much for bringing back the quality, that AAA names deserve.Good luck for the rest of the game releases this year, because for me Hogwarts Legacy holds the GOTY title for sure.

author: Thunder
review: Perfect blend of Adventure and Wizardry which rewards exploration. I was not a big harry potter fan or a fan of the universe that we are in this game, but boy O boy, I spent hours and hours just collecting the various collectables before even taking a step towards the main quest.Puzzles are a joy to solve rather than a tedious task. The world is brimming with lore and its a rare site to see a character conversing with other NPCS in a RPG game. The Combat mechanics are a blast and its refreshing to use our wand and spell casting and using devastating combos to blast away our enemies is amazing. I found it refreshing to play as a one of the member of the other 3 houses than Gryffindor ( OFC I chose Gryffindor as my house xD )well optimised so far ( can confirm as I saw their gameplay ) ( it even runs on low preset with GPU like 1650 ) without stuttering or crashes. ( getting nice fps on my 3060 with RTX on and frame rate drops a bit when exploring the open world areas outside hogwarts ) I recommend this game to every 1 who wants to pull a prank on their friends using various charms <3 10/10p.s : Don't use the bathroom where it says " out of order " (jk) though try it.

author: Zach_peterson4
review: Let me begin by saying this... I do not hate HL. It was fine. But the review says "Do you recommend this game?" and to that I say no. The game is a Harry Potter fans wet dream. Obviously... But to someone like me who was just a casual fan of HP, it isn't all that great.I went in with the hope of a good RPG experience. Which it delivers in some aspects. I'll organize this in a what they did well vs wrong for simplicity sake.What is done well-------------------* Graphics - Visually stunning with my high end PC. * Story - Engaging and well driven. Enough said...* Full - The open world is not barren. There is stuff everywhere. And there is detail within the detail* The characters - Voice, emotion, animation, etc. It is all there. And it is done well.What is done wrong-------------------* The wallhax scanning thingy - I am somewhat of a collector when I play games so having this game full of them started out as a nice thing. Unfortunately it became a nightmare when I would have to span revelio ever 10 seconds because the bell noise got louder and then randomly quieter. It was like I was being constantly gaslit by picture on the wall that doesn't even look special at all. It became a tedious process of going to a new room and spamming scan until I found every collectible in the room. Then move to the next room and do the same. Horrible.* Broom mechanics - As a general rule of thumb I play all 3rd person games with a controller. So keep that in mind. I did not test on kbm. Having altitude control bound to the same stick that controls the camera is literal hell. Just map a face button to ascend and descend. Other games do this so much better it's insane.* Factions - What house will you pick? Well it doesn't matter. Aside from certain clothing items changing colors it really does not do much. You get a different location where your commons are. That is it. HUGE loss on replay-ability and HUGE loss on weight of the choice.* PvE variety - Not many types of fantasy enemies in my fantasy game. * Combat - I have seen other reviews compare the combat similar to the Arkham games. I see the comparison. But If I had to choose who does it better I would 9 times out of 10 choose Arkham. Spells are cool and combing them can sometimes be cool but it just gets old fast. Like imagine playing Elden Ring and the first weapon you get is RoB and just use that through the whole game. Don't let me yuck your yum tho. It you liked it, great! I just didn't.* 1st world problem - I played it on a 49in ultra-wide. If you have one. You know what I am about to say. The menu system has everything spread out and it takes an eternity to move the cursor around to equip stuff. Again if you know, you know. I almost considered just using my mouse in menu to speed things up. I am by no means expecting devs to cater to an audience of like 2 percent. But the ability to turn up the speed of the cursor would have been nice (if there is one, I could not find it)* Loot - The Destiny style loot system where your loot is based off of your armor at the time of opening has its critics and its fans. I am sure you can gauge where I stand based on where this part of the review is. I am sure I missed some good and bad but here is what I got. For the 2 people that did not buy the game on release, this should be a good metric to gauge on. If you are here for HP lore and stunning detail then pop off. But if you wanted a good RPG experience then you may have to look elsewhere. To anyone thinking this is some kind of review bomb, I hope you get help. Please read the full review b4 making your mind up on which political side I am taking.

author: Alleria
review: 6 hours in the game so far, and I’m only scratching the surface. The open world is pretty large and absolutely beautiful. If you are a fan of the Harry Potter series, you will most likely enjoy the game. The music and sound effects are very much like the movies and are one more step to making you think you're not in a video game. The combat, though not the flashiest, feels extremely fluid and satisfying. Side quests are actually fun and meaningful, just like in Red Dead Redemption 2. Exploration is extremely fun, and you are always coming across something new to explore and investigate. Although the NPCs are a bit dull in this game, unlike RDR2, I still highly recommend playing it.

author: Seras Victoria
review: I'll go straight to the important stuff. * Is it good?Yes, it is.*Does look good?Yes, it does.*Is the map big?Yes, it is quite large I'd say.*Is the game long?That depends. Is 35 hours of main story enough for you? It is NOT for me. *Is there a lot to do?Yes, there is outside main story.*Is it repetitive?Yes, there is quite some repetitive things. So if you're an achievement hunter, I'm sorry."Do choices matter?No. Not even a tiny bit. I wish they did.*Are enemies varied?Kind of.*Does your house matter?Look at the previous one. It does not.*Did I hear stories will wary with house?If you did, it was a lie.*Is the price fair?That depends what you see as fair. For the short main story I'd say no.*Is it worth getting?I'd say yes. Although best would be to get it in discount only.

author: reynl.befall
review: First, the performance is quite bad, optimization  should be as important as game play content. Second, the story is getting boring after first 5 hours game play, the first chapter (before entering hogwarts) is great, quite engaged story and magnificent environment design. However that's it, the majority of main quest and side quest are quite boring, meaningless and repetitive. Last, the open world design is so old style, put it in few years back it is still good, but now, it feels so tired to see all kinds of marks in world map to tell you what to do and challenges listed  in backlog.Overall, I really want to give thumb up after first 5 hours game play, but after 35 hours playing now I decide to give thumb down, I cannot recommend the game only feels great in first chapter.

author: Longman
review: ** SPOILER FREE ***Don't go to the Steam discussions, avoid Reddit and uninstall Twitter. Some very salty activists are spoiling the plot because they can't stand how successful the game is, which is a touch odd given the game's seasoned with a pinch of wokeness, just enough NOT to ruin the overall taste, mind you.I digress, I pre-ordered this game solely based on how good 2002 Chamber of Secrets game was, I didn't even watch trailers not to spoil any of the fun for myself... and I'm happy to say this game is a gem! The gameplay's smooth and satisfying, story's quite interesting but first and foremost the world is full of puzzles, collectables and I keep on getting mind blown by its sheer vastness and detail. For me Hogwarts Legacy is up there with Witcher 3, I salute the developers for their dedication, ingenuity and care and J.K. Rowling for creating such an awesome world!P.S. Activists don't want you to have fun and might spoil it in the review section too!

author: LightAnisen
review: Absolutely enjoying myself with this. The world is hard enough, quit gate-keeping and let people enjoy things.

author: John
review: Best game I've played in years. Finally a AAA game where the devs not only care about the game but the franchise as a whole!

author: Darth Neko Chan
review: This game is extremely easy and has no challenging combat whatsoever even on hard. Your choices impact nothing in the story or the characters, you will just get some different dialogue and also there aren't different builds in the game so this means that replayability is basically non-existent. A lot of assets are not done in the same style which makes some things feel disjointed. Its almost like they didnt have much of an art direction and each artist did as they pleased. The character creator has barely any options and its mainly presets. It is also unoptimised with a lot of stuttering and FPS drops and there are loading screens basically everywhere and asset pop-in even when installed on an NVMe SSD. There are some bugs as well, more noticeably voice pitch changes sound like a robot.There are some good things like the music and character design. Every NPC is voice acted with some fairly decent actors. The lightning and atmosphere is done really well and also its just really cool to move around the wizarding world and see such a large part of it.Overall I'm fairly disappointed. It could have been so much more than what we actually got and I feel like if another studio developed the game it would have been so much better. But it is a step in the right direction and hopefully we will get more games like this which get increasingly better by each release. If I were to give it a rating I would say its about 6.5/10.

author: Enkai
review: No, in its current state. If Denuvo is removed and the PS-exclusive quest is added, then I'll flip this review.The game is a solid, well-deserved 7/10, but it had the potential to be a 9/10 or better. Some of its faults are definitely moddable away, we'll see what the community cooks up.Let's start with the good things. As a Hogwarts simulator, it's the best we've ever seen. Pretty much everything is  recreated in great detail, you can  open pretty much  every door, look around everywhere , and the game world  is so large it could've been  half the size and literally nobody  would've complained. It's massive. It does have some omissions though. Wizard currency is only talked about. Your money is just "gold" (a few lines of dialog accidentally refer to it as galleons but most of it calls it "gold", and if that was indeed galleons everything would be insanely expensive at 1800s prices).You can't sit anywhere but the ground, or sleep in your bed (sounds minor but over time it starts to feel weird). Teachers don't give "X points to [house]", but "points to [house]" (other than a cutscene or two). These are meaningless, I went to check my house's points and our hourglass had a grand total of 0 gems in its lower compartment after I won those points. It was easy to count.You can't IMAGINE how inconvenient travel was before Ignatia Wildsmith invented Floo powder!There are a few continuity errors: seventh-years' future OWL results are mentioned when it should be NEWTs, that kind of stuff. Nothing major.There is no Quidditch. Fair enough, that would've been a huge development undertaking, and the game already has issues with dev time allocation/budgeting. There is an explanation in-game as to why, and it makes sense in the game world.The game's faults are broadly in two categories: technical issues, and the writing/execution of the main story.The game still has Denuvo despite it having been defeated. To absolutely no one's surprise, most of the performance issues with this game are on the CPU side, even on "Low" settings. I had to manually reactivate through their website 4 times (I started counting after the third) because it wouldn't do it automatically. Feels nice to be a valued customer. Guess what kind of players do not have this issue at all.Graphics are... weird. You can see the ground loading in front of you in small tiles for 10+ seconds, even on a monster PC. Regardless of your settings, even on RT Ultra, there are some weird screen-space shadows (not ambient occlusion) that disappear as you rotate the camera or NPCs walk in front of them. Regardless of your settings, lakes will use screen-space reflection with the laughably bad reflections that entails, especially if you fly over them. Regardless of your settings (I'm noticing a pattern here), reflections stop working near the edge of the screen. If you turn RT off, a lot of reflections stop working entirely. Mirrors turn into blackboards. This is not exactly a groundbreaking problem, games a decade or more ago could solve this. This game was made with Unreal Engine 4, the tech is there for multiple different kinds of non-raytraced reflections.The game ships with an outdated version of DLSS that you can easily swap and get better results. The player shouldn't need to do this.There's a crazy amount of fog, beyond "we get it, it's Scotland". We're talking PS1 Silent Hill levels of fog, and very often. Get a fog removal mod.Consider disabling about half of the HUD elements as well, for better immersion.Binding spells to buttons is BAD. What's even worse is that to make it slightly less bad is locked behind TALENT POINTS. Most talents improve your spells directly in the game world, but some of them only serve to make controls less horrible. Your character does not gain any power, you just get to pause less often to rebind your spell slots. You could suffer through full manual rebinds, save all those talent points, and your character would not be an iota less powerful, only you more annoyed.Broom controls scream lazy-remapped-controller-port. There's an entire vertical axis on your mouse that's not used, and it would solve nearly everything with it.On Hard, around level 30 or so, enemies become HP sponges. It's not any harder to defeat them, just pure tedium. You can (and should) make it faster by using plants and potions, but this gives you another form of tedium as you have to replenish them (which is on half-to-1 minute timers).The true final boss is the camera controls and a target lock bug. Your character moves differently when there's a target locked, but even if you have unlocked it, sometimes it only frees the camera but not movement. I have died multiple times to this alone. Unbind that button entirely (it's Caps Lock by default) to avoid this. You don't need target locks, even on Hard.Items are MMO-like random drops. This makes zero sense in a single-player game. I went through the entire story without the default school uniform skin dropping that everybody else is wearing, and I was frequently checking the clothes shop to see if it was selling an item with that skin regardless of stats.And now for the elephant in the room. The main story and the writing. Where do I even begin...It's as if a different team made the main story. The world has such an enormous level of care and detail in it that you would completely understand if the devs had to cut some corners, but they barely did.The main story is the opposite.The writing goes out of its way to save voice lines and not even acknowledge choices that you made. Not the basic ones, not the Earth-shattering monumental ones. Mass Effect 3 would be proud of the extent of choice-cancellation, if it was done through good writing. It wasn't.Your character is 100% unisex. Disagree to do something, you'll discuss the specifics of doing it within 7 seconds anyway. There are some actual cringe scenes where someone that you're supposedly on good terms with only talks about you in the most generic, distant terms .The only choice that seems to be acknowledged is .  Unforgivable curses? This is really unexpected, given the enormous amount of voice acting that went into random NPCs talking or random events playing out that are only there for world-building and you might even miss. There are conversations between students that you can simply walk past and ignore, that are way longer and better-written than what you get as the hero. Hell, NPCs have things to say if your character is wearing PJs!Many quests don't handle the objective being complete already. Have you done the thing that I want? Sorry, I still have to tell you these two lines about my now non-existent problem before I can get surprised that you took care of it right after.I can't shake the feeling that two different teams were involved here. This is a AAA game, the devs should've had the budget for a few dozen extra voice lines on top of the insane amount that's already present in the game, especially considering the size of the map that goes above and beyond what anyone would've expected. Games more than a decade ago could pull this off, and with full voice acting. We could've sacrificed a copy-paste Ubisoft open world village or two for this.Bonus: there's a PlayStation-exclusive quest. Screw that. Buy the game once it's been added to PC.

author: mistercrocs
review: this game stole my life

author: Azza ☠
review: If you enjoy Harry Potter, you won't be disappointed. Combat is basic magic casting, but the game has a great storyline and is an action fastasy roleplaying game. Quite feels like that Rockstar game "Bully" in terms of gameplay. Nicely created characters and you can fully customise your own. The game guides you quite a bit and linear at the start, but I guess that's to make it easier for younger players. You can choose your house in Hogwarts Legacy through a Sorting Hat quiz or manually pick (Gryffindor, Slytherin, Ravenclaw, or Hufflepuff), which could lead to replay value and different experiences per house.

author: SamWhitetail
review: This game could use some optimization. Now on to the contriversal bit:As a transwoman, people think I am gonna be against the game. Why should I? Just because J.K. Rowling is transphobic doesn't mean I have to hate Harry Potter. I think the WW is interesting. I am more of a hate the player not the game mindset with this game. I don't like J.K. Rowling but I love Harry Potter. I grew up reading the books and was scared of the basilisk when the movie first came out. I loved that they made Dumbledore gay in Fantastic Beast. IMO I think Grinwald did what he did out of his love for Dumbledore. Oh and Sirona seems trans... Side note: I don't care that you think I am being stupid or a troll. I am stating MY opinion and I have that right, so bug off!

author: pwnz0r3d
review: First off, the outrage around this game is pointless noise from a select few and should be promptly ignored. You also don't need any prior knowledge of the Harry Potter universe before starting the game. It can be enjoyed by anyone.There's a massive amount of content here. Tons of quests, people to talk to, areas to explore and things to collect. All beautifully presented both as a narrative and graphically. The game obviously borrows a lot from other games in the open world genre, but also introduces many new mechanics - all of them working exceptionally well.Personally, I've experienced a few technical issues, but tweaking the settings largely eliminated most of them. The option menu is great and gives you a lot of liberty, but your experience might differ.It's also becoming increasingly rare to play a game without any form of microtransactions, which makes it ironic that the game is published by Warner Brothers - one of the absolute worst offenders. Avalanche Software seem to have gotten complete creative control with this one however, and they've done a tremendous job.2023 already have some heavy hitters released, and I'm pretty sure Hogwarts Legacy will be fondly remembered for years to come.

author: Imperator Aiur
review: Hogwarts Legacy is what i would consider a 'nothing new under the sun' RPG made very much with Witcher 3 as its central inspiration; barring some issues such as the games remarkably atrocious final boss, the game is competently made but feels sparse and hollow in many aspects. It's not a game i'd recommend, even if you are a Harry Potter Fiend, though i can imagine HP fans will enjoy the game much more than most.Almost every mechanic in the game is executed in the most basic, functional form; no attempt is made to innovate, improve, or even make it unique to this game. If you have played any other games in the past 10 years, you have almost certainly experienced every mechanic this game has to offer, and likely a better executed version.In essence, entirely ignoring all of the controversy surrounding this game it is frankly not worth your time nor money; it has nothing to offer. Those speaking highly of its acclaim are either blinded by their love of the setting, or supporting it due to its controversial nature.Speaking with the controversy in mind the game should absolutely be avoided.

author: Bryan Adams
review: Unlike a lot of other people, I had absolutely no expectations for this game. Actually, that's not entirely true, I had 1 expectation which was that I wasn't going to play Hogwarts Legacy. And no, I didn't hold that expectation because I couldn't bear the thought of playing a game loosely based on the works of a bigot, it was due to the simple unavoidable fact that I do not care about Harry Potter. Despite watching every single 1 of the I don't know, 5? or so movies and reading half a book, I never truly got it. It's just a wee lad magicking around, presumably in his imagination as he needs to escape the hellscape of his living situation under his uncle's stairs. Add to this the LEGO Harry Potter games not being anywhere near as good (IN MY OPINION) as the excellent Star Wars and Indiana Jones games, I was left in no way hyped for this game, and yes I know this isn't a LEGO game, which honestly minus points. After apparently entering some sort of trance and adding this game to my wishlist and then watching a friend play through some of the early sections I decided to buy it. After owning the game for only 12 days, I already have over 60 hours and 100% of the achievements. You really wouldn't think I have a full time job. I know J.K Rowling is getting a lot of hate lately and rightfully so but thank ♥♥♥♥ she decided that Hogwarts would be in Scotland. This game really wouldn't be the same if it were in England, granted some areas of the country could be made to look pretty great, the world we get to explore throughout this game is truly spectacular and incredibly well designed. Also, having gone to school in England I know first hand that the character who's eyes we experience this game through would actually just have been bullied the entirety of their first year after joining school late. Actually, that would probably happen in Scotland as well, going to have to mark that down as a severe inaccuracy within this game. Why are all the students so nice to someone who shows up a few years late to school and generally just nails everything? Every time I wake up in the dorm room, I am expecting another black eye or maybe a lewd drawing on my forehead, but no.After reading through the list of achievements, I expected I would need to complain about needing to reach the map room on all 4 houses, however as this only added an extra 3 hours of gametime, I didn't mind doing it, plus I got to do more Herbology lessons. Whilst on the topic of achievements, although I have no qualms with replaying the early levels, I really wish I didn't have to live through all of the Merlin Trials. Not because I found them too difficult, but due to the gall of Merlin forcing me to sit through 95 unskippable cutscenes. What a prick that man was, and truth be told I'm glad he's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ dead. Even when I am stood on top of the centre of his little leaf outline, I do not appear in the cutscene, how self-important do you have to be? The world doesn't revolve around you Merlin, you ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ useless pile of bones, it revolves around the sun, maybe if you spent more time learning science instead of being a ♥♥♥♥ you might have been able to notice that no one ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ likes you. At least I am only forced to see him being made out of leaves, because if I had to see his presumably hideous face NINETY FIVE times, I probably wouldn't have completed the game without prying out my eyes. Seriously, this guy makes me want an entire 9 hour storyline about the adventures of Peeves and Ignatia Wildsmith. That would be infinitely more enjoyable than hearing "Not so tricky after all, Merlin" one more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ time.I don't know if it was hidden within the digital deluxe version that I didn't pay for or maybe it is in an upcoming DLC, but I couldn't seem to find Dogwarts. Did this get cut or I just missed it? I thought it would be in the room of requirement but alas, 'twas only Deek and that would ruin my immersion.The lack of quidditch didn't really phase me too much, because again, I don't care about Harry Potter.  Besides, the story and various side quests give you enough of an opportunity to become the best student at just about everything else so adding another thing to the list of activities the playable character naturally excels at would probably be overkill. I mean, you already get to beat Professor Ronen at Summoner's Court so there's not really a higher peak in that regard. The guy is practically a god, and I wholeheartedly believe that he let me win that game just to boost my pride. Obviously I am not saying that Ronen is truly some omnipotent being, I just mean he is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cracked at grabbing balls from across a big plank while in competition with children.The story reminded me of the Mark Twain novel A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court, which for the uneducated is a fantastic read, and the subject of a wonderful 1949 film starring Bing Crosby. Now I'm not saying that the writers of this game copied from this book in any way, but their decision to make Merlin the primary villain of the game is a tad suspicious and should really be investigated as to where they came up with that idea. My word is Merlin a colossal waste of space. I hope he is not resting in peace but instead burning in hell like the evil piece of ♥♥♥♥ he is. I cannot stress this enough, NINETY FIVE UNSKIPPABLE CUTSCENES. It really puts Ranrok's crimes into perspective, I mean, what did the guy even do? Want a little bit more power so he could presumably enslave humanity? Big deal, were the machines truly the enemy in The Matrix Resurrections or was it the mere existence of the movie? At least I could skip that by never watching it, which isn't an option when it comes to Merlin's moon-sized ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ ego. I cannot believe when seeing the first Merlin trial completion I thought "huh, that was pretty cool" because after Merlin trial number 72 I was ready to shoot the ♥♥♥♥ like he shot Hank Martin in A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court.That prick aside, the characters in this game are very well written as well as the interactions the playable character has with each of them. It is a shame that at times you are forced into more linear storytelling as early on you can keep your experience with Fig a secret. Later in the game the character just blurts out to everyone that will listen that they can see and use ancient magic which completely negates the option of hiding this information from people in the first place. What if I don't want to trust everyone in Hogwarts?Now onto one of the best aspects of this game, and no I am not referring to Professor Garlick, but of course the music beautifully composed by Chuck E. Myers, Peter Murray and J Scott Rakozy. You don't really need to know that they were influenced by the work of John Williams, because of course they were, he's the best. Just kidding, of course I'm talking about Professor Garlick. It really is a shame that this game isn't more like Bully with you regularly attending classes to improve your grades, but instead you attend probably under 10 classes in total with a handful of additional assignments. I think it would add to the enjoyment of the game to feature more time in the classroom but primarily because it would mean attending more Herbology classes and as a result getting more time with Professor Garlick. I don't think I really need to go into detail as to why getting to spend more time in that classroom would be a bonus. If the sequel to this game isn't the story of you playing the replacement for Professor Fig, and you get to spend the entire game attempting to seduce Professor Garlick, I will be severely disappointed. There are already far too many stories in the Wizarding World focusing on kids.All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed this game, almost as much as I enjoyed writing this review and would have to place it firmly in my top 7 games on Steam. But seriously, ♥♥♥♥ Merlin and everything he stood for.

author: onionunion
review: Hard to believe it's been over 20 years since the first Harry Potter movie, and the fans have all grown up, made and forgot about their Myspaces, gone through their Doctor Who/Sherlock Holmes phases, made and deleted their tumblrs, glossed over Fantastic Beasts and watched Ladybird and Celine Sciamma's movies instead.Some of them got married, some got kids of their own and the simple pleasure of lusting over quirky British men doesn't do it anymore so the masses demand era-appropriate entertainment for a franchise that's been semidormant for a while. And era-appropriate entertainment it sure is.Hogwarts Legacy is a flavorless, unimmersive ESG hugbox wrapped in a Ubisoft carrot-dangling open world time-waster.The story and plot are beyond generic, the writing is dull and horribly underedited and you won't remember most of the cast in a week.The game's world is peppered all throughout with cynical corporate box-checking inclusivity, making this version of the 19th century Scotland demonstrate the kind of demographics even modern day Los Angeles can't boast.There's no curfew, no timetable-management, no mini-games or interesting activities. There are no real friendships or relationships outside of the dull main quest. Hogwarts students don't feel attraction or repulsion towards each other, they don't do anything and have no goals. What little depth they bothered to add to the rare side characters is all but negligible.The Houses -- seemingly one of the main themes of the entire franchise -- do nothing but determine the colors of your robes. There are no rivalries, no factions, no infighting, the House points mean nothing. The whole thing is all but discarded.Nothing you do or say matters, you can slam into an obstacle on a broom and nothing will happen, the loot is mind-numbingly boring and pointless. Learning the unforgivable curses, the inclusion of which is spoiled in advance by the overbearing UI, warrants no reaction from the Wizarding world. The combat bears no challenge, the time of day can be changed with the press of one button and most of the game, once again, is spent brainlessly following what the UI tells you to do rather than, you know, PLAYING it.Hogwarts Legacy is filled to the brim with signs of how little effort went into its open world, with extras spawning in and despawning as you rotate the camera, people floating in mid-air, people simply disappearing every night, none of the NPCs reacting to anything you do and all the other stuff that would be endlessly ridiculed all over the internet if it were any other franchise, but I guess it's okay when it's 'Arry Pottah.

author: Bipolar ⎛⎝Fawx⎠⎞
review: I'll be that person. If the Hogwarts exploring experience doesn't sound like it's worth the game price, don't waste your money. If you grew up playing the original trilogy on pc.. Definitely get it because without even questing.. The visuals and exploration, to me, make it worth the price and more. Yes, it is lacking optimisations but a simple graphics tweak can fix it, in its current state. (pre release opinion)This game was a dream come true and I'm glad I got my old trilogy CD's out to play them prior to this launch. I now vouch to be a Hogwarts Legacy supporter for life. Can't wait for the mods and the sequel! Most underrated game of the year, all over people hating J.K. Rowling for speaking facts, no hate here. The last great game I played was Elden Ring, so I'm very grateful to be blessed with these games 2 years in a row! GOTY for sure! (Unless possible Elden Ring DLC)Visuals 10/10Exploration 10/10Optimisation 8/10Main story 10/10Side quests 9/10Don't be fooled by the haters, this game deserves GOTY for sure.

author: Moga CMDR
review: Disney Dreamlight Valley and Forspoken had a baby!This game is very good at some things, and merely OK at others. This game does a fantastic job of depicting Hogwarts and Hogsmeade, and a solid job with its combat and execution of the story, but falls short in other areas.I spent hours walking around the castle, looking at all the finer details and failing to uncover all its mysteries and puzzles. It is a beautiful masterpiece worth touring in its own right. I also spent time visiting all the shops in Hogsmeade and enjoying the spectacle. Hogwarts and Hogsmeade are the main strengths of this game world, with the rest of the world being no different than anything you might find in another open-world game. Once you leave these two areas, things get bland fast.It's a good, solid game but after beating the main story I am not motivated to continue, and I certainly have no interest in replaying from scratch. The gameplay is a bit shallow and there isn't a reason to dig deep into the systems. But it can still be fun for a bit.

author: syndin
review: Don't let anyone tell you, you can't buy Hogwarts Legacy - remember that there is no such thing as ethical consumption under capitalism. No matter what you buy, you are supporting some sort of unethical practice. So by their own logic, these people shouldn't buy anything at all. In the end, they are just hypocrites who like to hold others to impossibly high ethical standards that they themselves don't follow. I find it even weirder that people are willing to tear down a game that has nothing to do with JK except that they're using her famous IP... something many companies have done over the last decade or so. Why so willing to f*ck over the game devs just because of the IP they're using? JK has no hand in the game whatsoever and is barely getting royalties from it, only because it's her IP/Brand. If she had a hand in the game, then that would be more understandable, but that's not the case. This is the equivalent to showing up to a birthday party and calling everyone at the party a bigot just because the party is Harry Potter themed. Now that.. well, all that is out of the way. I absolutely love this game with every fiber of my being - it's everything I hoped it would be and more. The world is vast and the castle alone feels huge, I can't even count the amount of times I'd get distracted just simply exploring the castle and being in absolute awe by the design of it all. I love the way they've handled collecting items and solving puzzles, the collectibles aren't just a simple go here and find this, they can be behind puzzles and encourage exploration, which I've gladly enjoyed doing. Combat may seem simplistic compared to other modern games but hey, I found it to be pretty enjoyable and I have yet to tire of it. The game allows for a level of customization I honestly didn't expect but I appreciate all the same. Your Hogwarts house determines what unique area of the castle you live in, you can transmogrify your gear with a good amount of options you collect and you have a personal space to customize and decorate!Everything feels smooth and honestly it plays pretty well, I will say there have been a lot of lighting bugs here and there, I'd enter a bright, beautiful room only for it to feel like someone turned the sun off. It is a MASSIVE game, the general main story takes 20-30 hours to complete and that isn't counting collectibles or side quests, so many collectibles, I've been playing for 11 hours now and I have yet to unlock my broom LOL. The whole world feels alive, ghosts flying around, students having conversations, everything around you is doing something. It's been a while since I've played something that felt so fleshed out. I could sing praises on this game all day long but all in all I wholeheartedly recommend, whether you're a huge HP fan or simply an RPG fan, chef kisses all around.
