author: Anja
review: I have seen no genuinely valid criticisms of this game, only of the author behind its universe. My review is not about Rowling's political takes or any controversy, but about the state of the gameplay experience.10/10So, let me talk about the game. It is incredible. I am not, and never have been, a fan of the Harry Potter series. This is not for any reason in particular, I was always just too busy obsessing over Tolkien's universe as a kid. Every time I tried to get into the books I failed to do so and went to another series. This does not mean I can deny the sheer brilliance of the world-building and comfort it provided many other children, however. This is now a comfort I know myself.This game has made me love Hogwarts. it has gotten me into something I always thought I hated. I have given it the true chance I never gave the books (but now will). It makes me feel so free and so cozy. I have never experienced a more immersive game in which I play as a witch and utilise magic so wonderfully. The school is warm and welcoming, the characters are well-designed and voiced, and the creatures are all so unique. I am immediately immersed as I open the game and load into the school.From class "assignments" to serious story quests, there is always something to do in terms of tasks. Outside from this, I find myself spending time flying around on my broom for no reason other than I love the way it feels, or exploring the Forbidden Forest just to see how lively and beautiful the world is. Jumping mushrooms, singing flowers, and rolling birds. I have never before experienced such a magical game. Sometimes, it makes me feel like a witch as intended. Other times, I escape the school grounds for a while and feel like a fairy.The school itself is also so whimsical, from speaking portraits to poltergeists and ghosts that feel as though they are just like any other people (or at worst, annoying) rather than frightening. As someone dipping into Rowling's universe for the first time really, I am blown away by just how comforting everything is even when taking elements that are otherwise portrayed as "scary" or negative. The game takes elements from some of my favourite genres, too, allowing you to do so many things. These include botany, potion-brewing, and DECORATING A HUGE SPACE! I spent ages playing with furniture, colours, and wallpapers last night after unlocking my unique room. Seriously, I keep discovering more and MORE to do in the game. I see myself spending hundreds of hours in it.As for soundtrack, it is as beautiful as the scenery. The writing is, too. Everything is. In terms of inclusion, it marks every box. I am a woman who is attracted to the same sex and running into Nora Treadwell was absolutely heart-warming. An older lesbian couple who is passionate about archaeology and history?! Precious...Please play this game. Please do not let the opinions of chronic Internet dwellers take this magical experience away from you by convincing you that somehow your purchase funds any sort of bigotry. And if you are those people, touch grass. I have already had multiple people block me on this platform just for playing the game. It is utterly ridiculous how such a wholesome experience is being twisted into something so sinister when it should not be.

author: ✅HappyBird
review: Game of the Year ? <3

author: edzone
review: Incredible, my childhood dream game come to life.

author: Psaimon
review: If you're a fan of the Harry Potter series and you've always dreamed of attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, then this RPG game is definitely for you. The game offers a fantastic virtual world that is beautifully designed with great attention to detail, and it is an absolute joy to explore.One of the things that stands out in this game is the great scenery that transports you into the magical world of Hogwarts. From the grand hall to the common rooms, everything is well-crafted, and the visual effects while casting spells are breathtaking. It makes you feel like you're in the midst of a Harry Potter movie.Another great aspect of the game is the lovely characters that you meet and interact with. The NPCs are very well-developed and add depth to the story. It's fun to engage with them, learn their stories, and explore their backgrounds.Furthermore, the deep exploration of the game world is a standout feature. There is always something new to discover, whether it's a secret passage or a hidden treasure. The game offers a rich and immersive world that makes it easy to lose track of time.There are a variety of fun mini-games that provide a break from the main quest. Lastly, the intense combat in the game is both challenging and rewarding. Battles require strategy, timing, and good use of spells. It adds an exciting element to the game and keeps you on your toes.Overall, this game is a must-play for any Harry Potter fan. It offers a captivating virtual world, well-designed scenery, lovely characters, deep exploration, fun mini-games, and intense combat. It is a must-have for any RPG lover who loves exploring immersive worlds.

author: Log Halley
review: 8/10game is good, wish it focused more on being a student at hogwarts and less about being a hero/chosen one saving the lands of Scotland its too little of a student wizard RPG, and too much of a generic fantasy open world action gamegonna drop tons of complaints in no particular order- the game is too little simulative. cant sleep, cant sit, cant even emote for screenshots— we can eat, but its just grabbing bites of decorative items. whats the point of the great hall? — the castle at night is completely empty including dorms. wheres everyone gone? — also there's no curfew at all. which i found weird because i played other harry potter games. — classes are underdeveloped. theres only 1 each, and then the assignments. you go, kill 2 wolves, come back and you learn a spell. could have been fun, its just a chore this way— no house cup— no quidditch— no potions minigame - the loot/gear system sucks, and cosmetic being tied to it sucks more— equipment with quality tiers doesnt fit the setting at all, no reason why putting on glasses should increse my defence— anytime i change gear, i have to go back and change the appearance of the item. most people dont want to wear funny glasses, but need them for stats, so we have to put them on and then change the appearance to have back our look— also there's too much gear, and most of it is pointless. so many times i get into a dungeon, i solve a puzzle, i win a fight, and my reward is a jacket with worse stats than the one i have. this happens hundreds of times, filling up my inventory, making me go back and forth from hogsmeade to sell the stuff, with no button to sell it all, which means all the items have to be sold one by one, and there's hundreds— too many cosmetics clip with each other. some scarves are nice, but they dont fit my other clothes- the open world is handled the ubisoft way— its big for the sake of being big, and its filled with hundreds of pointless copy-pasted activities. there are way way too many copy-pasted merlin trials, and their unskippable cutscene kills me a little every time it plays— also dungeons, and in a way hamlets. copy-pasted content made to fill a map that's too big for no reason- MC is a psychopath— this character kills hundreds and blames them after— i cant understand how avada kedavra is unforgivable, but reducing someone to the size of a mouse and stepping on them to death isnt— we kill bad evil poachers, while we kidnap animals building our noahs ark to farm their ingredients. the excess animals we "rescue", we sell for gold. totally unlike poachers right— i know this is a game, but how our story is that we're a wizard for a few days and we already manage to kill both goblins and adult wizard could have been handled better— also the character repeats his reaction lines too much. same for the floo powder lady.- no companion system— we get people with us on some missions, but most of the time we're alone. i played the harry potter games on ps2 and our character was almost never alone. skyrims been out a few months, shouldnt be complicated to copy the way companions work— also houses are made pointless. i get that you didnt want to make every slytherin evil and every gryffindor good, but you went way too far in the other direction, making houses just colors to wear. there’s also very little friend/enemy dynamic with other students— also where's the companion from ravenclaw? we get 1 character with a questline from every other house, other than ravenclaw. maybe i missed it but i dont think so. amit is fun, he should have more quests— why no pets? we're at hogwarts, yet we cant have a owl, a mouse, a cat. we can name animals in the room of requirements, but our interactions are limited to magically feeding and brushing. cant even pet them. - character creation sucks a lot— too little options, and my characters look different than it did in the character creator. seems like hes been taking daily sunbaths for 2 weeks between when i created him and when i got to play him- broom controls are bad, and the up/down being tied to the right stick means we wont ever be able to control the camera to look up or down- alohomora is a spell used to open locks, it shouldnt lead to a lockpicking minigame— also alohomora having 3 tiers sucks. unlocking it and then still being unable to open all doors made it feel wrong, and it adds the chore of looking for demiguises before exploring more- olivander becomes useless after the game. wish he would at least sell wand handles- wish we had a POV mode to take screenshots. author: Darkendone
review: Hogwarts Legacy in my opinion is a okay game that if designed differently (Flying and Summoners court) could have be an outstanding game.  My personal favorite part is the care of the magical creatures, but the dueling is great fun as well. Other things that I considered notable fun, Herbology, Potions, and decorating and customizing your very own Room of Requirement with Deek the House Elf. The games graphics look amazing and overall the locations you get to visit are amazing.  83 Floo Flames (Fast Travel) locations really help a character get around, so make sure you get every one! The game has a fair amount of redundancy within the game itself, with the main quests and side quests which can kind get super grindy for lack of better word. The game has 13 main quests (and this is depending on you view of things in my opinion), and roughly 57 side quests to be completed is you are wanting to get the ALL achievements (45 total achievements,at the time of the writing of this review seems to be bugged, more on this in my review). All of the main and side quests are required to complete the story mode of the game to get the achievement which gets a little old and somewhat frustrating. Other sources of frustration and further grinding can found in locating and solving the "Merlin Trials".  Consisting of 95 various puzzles that you activate using the herb Mallowseet from Herbology. The puzzles vary if different challenges that you must solve using the various spells you learn at school such as Jumping on blocks, Zapping spheres, Lighting Pyres (via Confringo Spell), Rolling a giant ball into a bowl (using Accio and Depluso), rotating blocks until the are properly align on the accositate pillar (Using Flipendo). Another is locating all the 30 Demiguise statues to Learn all 3 levels of the Alohomora Spell from Gladwin Moon (this ages Hagrid apparently). Also, another annoyance to me were the Depluso rooms a Hogwarts, after you have learn the Depluso spell(s) a new side quest will open where need discover not one, but two depluso rooms and solve said puzzles encase therein. I recommend searching the Internet or Steam for a walkthrough, they really are painful and not fun in my opinion.Another particularly frustrating achievement "Collectors Edition" where if you are someone (like me) who wishes to complete at game 100 percent will be driven CRAZY!!! In order to achieve this rather daunting collections you will need to complete 10 collections in order to get this achievement: (Don't say I didn't warn you) 1. All 9 Potions and Magical Plants in the game2. All 67 Enemies in the game3. All 86 Appearances collected in the game4. All 150 Revelio Pages in the game5. All 13 Rescueable Beasts are Encountered in the game6. All 75 Traits are collected in the game7. All 42 Wand Handles are collected in the game8. All 140 Conjurations are collected in the game (SUPER FLAWED)9. All 16 Ingredient items in the game10. All 13 Brooms collected in the gameFlying is a NIGHTMARE, I tried both my trusty keyboard and an X-Box One controller and I could not find a good way to go, the 3-D/camera considerations make this absolutely frustrating for the challenges and quests, but I did find flying around the world to reach certain areas and things in the world is workable, but I personally think this just could have been so much better in my opinion, lucky for me you can skip this part, but boy what a lost opportunity and I would loved to have had the opportunity to skip summoners court all together, the challenges just seems flawed to me all the way around, I feel the hardest opponent was Leander Prewett, who happens to be your first official Summoners Court battler, and I found you had to hear his pompous butt way too much for my liking, I hope that perhaps they will review this one every match after this one is WAY easier than he is in my opinion. In general I have found the 3-D aspects of this game make a variety of challenges and some other worldly bugs (getting stuck midair or in the steps you just summoned (the bone staircases in the crypts) are fairly common, and can be eliminated by exiting the game and coming back in, but this of course could have been corrected with some rigorous beta testing in my opinion) and can cause you to have some issues as well which makes the game frustrating at times to keep a groove going. My last concern is not a major one, but I find this last achievement a little petty, the Finishing Touches achievement which requires you to use Ancient Magic on every character in the game.  As there are 67 characters in the game, and if you have beaten the game already, you cant necessarily complete this with you 40 level character sadly.  On top of this there is an achievement where you have to play the game with each house in order to unlock the map room (a key part in the actual game). So needless to say you just keep grinding and grinding. As of today 4/25/2023 I have logged over 350+ hours in this game. So I can honestly say I have played VERY thoroughly so is it worth the price of admission, no, not for the Deluxe Edition in my opinion, no, some of the poor design consideration really hurt this title in my opinion. I think the multiple teams that had worked on this project may have had struggles to complete this by the deadlines Warner Brothers Games set. I also think that the grindy spots also really hurt its chances in the long run for replayability. So it is my honest opinion to pick this up on a SALE if you can get it, as it is fun in some portions of the game and you do get the Hogwarts and Hogsmeade feels, it is nice, but this does not make up for the flaws.

author: GunGuitarist
review: Ok, this has been driving me crazy for seven movies now, and I know you're going to roll your eyes, but hear me out: Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.Here's why:Think about how quickly the entire WWWIII (Wizarding-World War III) would have ended if all of the good guys had simply armed up with good ol' American hot lead.Basilisk? Let's see how tough it is when you shoot it with a .470 Nitro Express. Worried about its Medusa-gaze? Wear night vision goggles. The image is light-amplified and re-transmitted to your eyes. You aren't looking at it--you're looking at a picture of it.Imagine how epic the first movie would be if Harry had put a breeching charge on the bathroom wall, flash-banged the hole, and then went in wearing NVGs and a Kevlar-weave stab-vest, carrying a SPAS-12.And have you noticed that only Europe seems to have a problem with Deatheaters? Maybe it's because Americans have spent the last 200 years shooting deer, playing GTA: Vice City, and keeping an eye out for black helicopters over their compounds. Meanwhile, Brits have been cutting their steaks with spoons. Remember: gun-control means that Voldemort wins. God made wizards and God made muggles, but Samuel Colt made them equal.Now I know what you're going to say: "But a wizard could just disarm someone with a gun!" Yeah, well they can also disarm someone with a wand (as they do many times throughout the books/movies). But which is faster: saying a spell or pulling a trigger?Avada Kedavra, meet Avtomat Kalashnikova.Imagine Harry out in the woods, wearing his invisibility cloak, carrying a .50bmg Barrett, turning Deatheaters into pink mist, scratching a lightning bolt into his rifle stock for each kill. I don't think Madam Pomfrey has any spells that can scrape your brains off of the trees and put you back together after something like that. Voldemort's wand may be 13.5 inches with a Phoenix-feather core, but Harry's would be 0.50 inches with a tungsten core. Let's see Voldy wave his at 3,000 feet per second. Better hope you have some Essence of Dittany for that sucking chest wound.I can see it now...Voldemort roaring with evil laughter and boasting to Harry that he can't be killed, since he is protected by seven Horcruxes, only to have Harry give a crooked grin, flick his cigarette butt away, and deliver what would easily be the best one-liner in the entire series:"Well then I guess it's a good thing my 1911 holds 7+1."And that is why Harry Potter should have carried a 1911.

author: Neoyoshi
review: It's flipping amazing, the world building alone is phenomenal.  The rougher spots of the game are certainly in the performance department- although this varies from pc build to pc build from what i have seen; as of typing this i'm installing the day 1 patch, but i have been playing since the 7th during early access.Story i can't really comment on too much since i'm admittedly still quite early into the game; there is definitely this vibe of allowing you to go off the beaten path and just do what you want at your own pacing, so that's what i have done, i've spent most of my time exploring and trying to get into places i'm not allowed. (naughty Slytherin student goals)This is without question a game designed for the fan of the Wizarding world in mind; but I feel like the average gamer who loves open world games and collection/trophy hunters will also really find some enjoyment.I am very much looking forward to seeing what the devs have planned for this game post-launch, but for now, i still have SO frickin much to do in this game.

author: zingmars
review: Not a huge Harry Potter fan, but I suppose it's okay overall.The first thing is that the graphics look fairly decent. Performance wise though - it does push your hardware quite a bit. I tried playing it on my old machine (GTX 970, i5-4690, 16GB DDR3) and it was playable - but only at 720p (w/ FSR2 upscaling it to 1080p) on low settings, and you only got 30fps (20fps in some intensive places like Hogwarts and Hogsmeade). If you're used to consoles it might be playable, but overall you'll need a somewhat recent PC to play this.What impressed me most was Hogwarts itself. The place genuinely feels like a huge labyrinth, which is what I would expect from a magical castle. There's always some secret somewhere... Which brings to what I feel is the game's biggest weakness. The world is designed as your average open world Ubisoft game. The map is pretty big, but it's also filled with time wasters - dumb puzzles (that repeat), collectables, the occasional enemy camp that has the same enemies every other camp has. Oh, what's this? Yet another Merlin trial? Yeah nah, I'll pass. The game also does try to push you to re-explore places (i.e. with the lockpicking skill upgrades), though you quickly realise there's no point in that because all you're getting is just samey RNG loot.Story wise it's about what you would expect from modern AAA. Some quests are decent , some are just not that memorable. The main story line is... okay, but it's just not that praiseworthy. The funniest thing to me, and probably to many others, is how you can be an edgy, unforgivable-curse casting monster and nobody will really care about it. There's a huge disconnect between what you are (a 15-year old student) and what you do (a mass murderer, a poacher that "saves" the animals (wink-wink)). I know it's just the game being a game, but it does feel a bit weird at times. You can literally cast the worst unforgivable curses in front of your teachers and they'll be like "please don't kthx".Overall it's a beautiful game, that apparently does an okay job at bringing the world of Harry Potter to life. It held my interest long enough for me to beat it, so I guess I can recommend it. If you're into Harry Potter you'll certainly enjoy the world, though I'm not sure if that demographic will like the collect-a-thon parts.

author: Mousey
review: Avalanche truly nailed it. The world, the story, the characters, all perfect. Even my biggest worry, the combat, feels incredible once you unlock a few spells. All in all, a very rare 10/10. Can't wait to see what Avalanche works on next.

author: iGotMoxy
review: If you'd have told me ten years ago that the guys that produced Rage 2 (and the arkham games, and mad max, but that doesn't fit the sentiment i'm trying to create here) created a subdivision for Harry Potter related games and hired out the group that developed thehunter: Call of the Wild to make an open world story driven collectathon set in the wizarding world... i'd have told you that game would probably be a mess.SURPRISINGLY... I only have three real complaints. Pacing of the story had moments where I could feel the padding. A sence of urgency is placed on the Main Story and then someone just says "yeah, but not yet" and your forced to go do another trial.Second Complaint is Audio. Some of the story moments were recorded with live recordings. Like someone just took a cellphone outside and just recorded the sounds of a backyard, or a fireplace. no adjustment of the levels no detail work. Just loud and jarring. Couple that with cleanly edited voice work from talented professionals in a booth and it makes for an awkward listening experience. Then some of the voices you could hear where modulation was being applied or no editing happened at all. an example; NPC is giving me a quest, our characters are outdoors, I can hear the echo from the NPC's voice as if it were happening in a closed space. Like the sound you hear if you recorded your voice in a room with no dampening on the walls and a wood floor. Lastly... Lockpicking. I'm a wizard that can summon lighting and instantly kill trolls, reduce the size of giant spiders to be able to step on them, or turn a living being into an exploding barrel and throw them into another living being to cause an explosion that harms everything around them... but I have to go through a mini game to pick locks. I get it... but like... let wizards do wizard things and leave the tedium somewhere else eh?That's it. The only things I really would give this game grief over. and I didn't even mind the pacing that much because the combat was FUN. I didn't care how the main story got padded out because I knew they were going to send me into another fun fight. I enjoyed going out and picking up Revelio pages because the world is interesting. Some of the puzzles, the Depulso rooms especially, were a joy to try and figure out.I wouldn't call this a GOTY by any means, it follows a lot of the same tropes you'd expect from this genre, and does fall into some of the same pitfalls because of those tropes, but Avalanche did an amazing job for a developer that isn't known for this genre.

author: Doza
review: I've waited since the first "Harry Potter" game on something like this.Running around in a majestic, huge and magical castle around. Dream came true. Usually i don't pre order. But i had to even more. :trolol: I am very easy to satisfy! (was already satisfied to hear a new game comes out)I was very confident about this game, since i followed it (end of 2021). What can i say.. it's magic, probably. Already told my boss that i am attending a school after work. Didn't tell him that it was Hogwarts.Long story, no sense..I made the Wizard Test online at Warner Bros website. I wanted to go Slytherin.. but the hat made it's decision. So.. i am a Hufflepuff. Connected my account with the game, scanned the QR code and got all the goodies.The intro, the music is beatiful and truly epic. Goosebumps and shivering. Voice acting, animations. I am playing the game with a controller. Super comfy, gives me bit of nostalgic feeling. The controller feels super nice to play with. Also the cast/spells and interactions you do with it.Overall i am astonished so far (remember i am easily satisfied). Put the game on hardmode if you want it "more" Souls-like feeling (still - easy), and roll around. It's truly amazing. And i am glad i pre-ordered and started early. I usually don't do this anymore. But this is just an amazing experience for each wizard or sorceress, no-thing else. :trolol:I am playing since Tuesday.First off, no game breaking bugs or anything like that. A few happy little accidents, but that didn't bother me. The exploring of it all (from start to the first run through the school) is just WOW. Taking my time everywhere. If you open menue, inventory and map you can see already what's ahead of you. The map and content is just big and you'll have a blast exploring it.There's so much love in every detail. Spot of interest? cast a spell! Something flying around? cast a spell! Something to reveal? You won't believe but, cast a spell! The more you reveal with one of the first spells.. the more you get addicted to that nicely "bing" let's you use it even more.Just to find from where that "bing" is. In the beginning you might not be quite sure where to look. Use it as much as needed. Sometimes you have to be close to that "bing" and look at that "bing".There is a story, explanation of background from the "bings" you reveal .. whatever.. btw. you can pet all cats you come across.If you still reading, thank you for your time. I wish i could explain it to you how it feels for me, better.. but i'm not a wizard.This game will only get better. It's already everything i ever wanted since the PS1. :)Enjoy wizards & sorceress'

author: QuiverKnight
review: Hogwarts Legacy is the game I have been dreaming of for a lifetime. From my childhood to adulthood. This game is deep and mysterious, capturing the brightest and darkest elements from the world of Hogwarts. The direction the developers have taken represents a revival of the Harry Potter series - one that is led by fans who understand and love the world and can expand it in a meaningful and authentic way, much like Dave Feloni's & the Andor team did for Star Wars.As a lifelong fan of the Harry Potter books and movies, I was enchanted by the magical world and as a young child frightened by the darker moments in the series, such as the Chamber of Secrets. The combat in Hogwarts Legacy is truly fantastic and only improves as you progress through the game. I have only experienced a glimpse, but I am already imagining how my late-game dark wizard character will play, drawing inspiration from the best moments in the movies. The combat is fast-paced and aggressive, reminiscent of the cafe ambush scene and the battle against the Death Eaters in the Order of the Phoenix. It's clearly inspired by games like Batman: Arkham and Shadow of War, with quick strikes, deflects, and parries that are highly satisfying. On top of this strong foundation, there is an extensive array of spells that allow you to dominate the battlefield in creative ways, whether you choose to incinerate your enemies, batter them with kinetic force, or strike them down with dark magic. I have unlocked the ability to modify my spells with "ancient magic", and I envision a build in the late game where I can curse my enemies, disarm them with expelliarmus, and then strike them all down with avada kedavra as the greatest dark wizard of the age. These modifications to basic spells (which are already enjoyable to combine) will make you feel like you're playing out the duel between Dumbledore and Voldemort in the Ministry.As a fan of RPG's, including Mass Effect, Dragon Age, and The Witcher (though I was disappointed by Cyberpunk's lack of impactful player decisions), I appreciate morally ambiguous stories. Hogwarts Legacy offers constant opportunities for player choice, some subtle and others more significant. There are many small choices that affect your relationships with other characters, who you can accompany on quests, and your reputation in the game. For example, winning a practice duel in class can earn you respect and admiration, while losing might result in disdain. Although I am still early in the game, I have already encountered fleshed-out NPCs, each with their own agendas and personalities. I recently completed a quest where a Slytherin girl tried to manipulate me into retrieving something for her from a dangerous location. I agreed, but only in exchange for a reward, which earned her respect and surprise. Alternatively, you could have completed the task out of kindness (or to gain her favor) or kept the item for yourself.I could continue to sing the praises of this game, but I think it's clear that there is a great deal of love and care put into it by the developers. The setting is rich and immersive, and the graphics are gorgeous and customizable. I am eager to see what other surprises the game has in store, and I look forward to future DLC. It's worth noting that, in 2023, it is becoming increasingly common for games to be incomplete at launch (such as Cyberpunk 2077 and Darktide), but so far, Hogwarts Legacy feels complete and well-rounded. I highly recommend it to fans of the Harry Potter franchise and to RPG enthusiasts alike.

author: Velzanna
review: It's everything my twelve year old self ever wanted. The world is expansive, it's lived-in, it's beautiful and engaging and fun. Those who do not wish to buy it because they are unable to separate the art from the artist are doing themselves a disservice. This is a beautiful game and an amazing and inclusive experience that would be a shame to ignore just because of the twisted beliefs of She-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named.

author: 💕𝓢𝓱𝓪𝓭𝓸𝔀🐾
review: First off, if you want to enjoy the game without anyone influencing you, then I'd highly suggest that you stay away from that  forum. I've spent the better portion of an hour there on the first day of release for us that pre-purchase the Deluxe Addition. It seems to be flooded with Racists & Transgender Haters. You would be hard pressed to find anyone that just wants to talk about the game in general without one of those  morons hijacking the thread. Needless to say, I haven't returned there.The game is enchanting, and wonderfully done. I have no issues once I figured out what graphic settings gives me the best bang for my money without loosing the immersion. My settings are Ultra, but I leave  disabled until some sort of Optimization patch comes along, the graphics are gorgeous enough without it, and my pictures speak for themselves. The game also supports NVidia's Insel Photo Mode.Getting around is easy enough for me, and there are several ways to do it, but I'll let you discover them for yourself. The voice acting is top notch in my opinion, and the characters are both charming, and engaging. Cut-scenes give the game more depth, and you'll get to know some of your friends, and acquaintances this way. The game is a story, so try to live it.I find this game is best played in a dark, or dimly lit room. You'll see why once you play it. Try to leave the real world behind you once you close the door to your room. So give the game a chance without any forum BS to sway your mind.If you come here to spread your Hate, Flame & Troll, I'll quickly delete your comments, and block you. I could care less how many Hilarious & Jester awards your childish mind gives me. They spend just a well on goodies as any other award. So if you want to waste them on me... go for it!I play games for my enjoyment, and nobody else's. That's the way I believe they should be played regardless of Race, or Gender haters trying to influence yours, and my enjoyment. It's just a game.

review: taking me straight back to my childhood. A+ for that.

author: UltimateGOD
review: Hogwarts Legacy is one of the most anticipated games since the beginning of the Harry Potter Saga of books and films, a game in which you and the protagonist of your own story in  the wizarding world and can explore everything you have always read or seen in the movies. Hogwarts Legacy was a game that since its announcement was awaited by all its fans and people interested in exploring this magical world, more with a release with problems on the pc, this game really worth it, I come to point out that this review is being written after 2 months of release, because I would like to know if the problems have been fixed,  let's talk about the positives.Hogwarts Legacy in the end and a good game, not excellent, but good and honest, with a story good and captivating enough to hold you and at the same time a fun gameplay and managing to provide you with good hours of gameplay, more with the optimization done on the pc I do not believe that it is worth the price charged,  more if you get it from 30% or 40% off and a good addition to your library and will have provide a good game.

author: LunaKBN
review: I spent most of my free time playing this game since its release. The combat is fun, there are plenty of combos to make use of while fighting, but spells could use some rework (mostly Alohomora with its absolutely pointless minigame) and seeing the same types of enemies half a minute within walking from one place to the next - or even quicker while flying - gets boring quickly.The world itself is beautiful and well-made, yet it still has a certain emptiness to it. There is some dialogue between the NPCs found in it, but they repeat the same thing over and over and over again without reacting to anything the main character achieves. It is also supposed to be an RPG, yet there are usually only two dialogue choices (not counting questions before accepting a quest) one for a goody two-shoes and another for a rude character. The problem is, even the choice that is worded rudely before picking sounds as if the first option was picked. They are practically the same. That is my biggest problem with the game. Nothing matters, nothing reacts. You can't talk to NPCs, not even students inside Hogwarts unless they give some sort of fetch-quest or collection quest. I usually play good characters, so it is not an issue for me, but for those that want evil or grey choices during quests will be disappointed. I remember one (1!) out of dozens of quests, where my choice mattered. Where is the RPG in that?Don't even get me started on the collections. Other than the field guides that contain lore for the world, all others are completely useless and are only there to lengthen the playtime. So are the trials that are all over the world and so easy and repetitive that it makes you think what Merlin thought of his fellow students' mental capabilities when he thought them up. He certainly had a lot of time on his hands, though...And the story. What is there to say about the story? It's... there? I guess. I really like this game, but there is nothing in the main story that I am completely in awe of. It's all just mediocre and shallow. The twist about one of the characters was very predictable and most of the side-quests are as forgettable as the NPCs that gave them. The "companions" are not so bad, but they could have made it so that they could be dragged along on adventures whenever. And the main character. The "Fifth-year" is a completely blank, soulless character with no background, no personality, no explanation as to why they start their studies in their fifth year. It's never explained why, only the fact that they are not the only ones that this happened to. That's just lazy writing if you ask me. The main antagonist's reason for hating wizardkind is... well, mentioned in a sidequest. The last boss fight was good at least. Not much of a challenge over level 30, but still good. There should have been more bosses like that one. Overall I'd still say this game is worth a playthrough, but I doubt I would start another after finally getting 100% on my first.

author: Yash
review: I don't think I have ever had so much joy from playing one single game before until now. This game plays a perfect part is satisfying my inner-child and my nerdy side for the universe of harry potter, I feel very privileged to play the game and I cannot wait to see what else is put into the game.Thank you for making me feel more joy than I ever have. <3

author: AngelKittyxo
review: This is, hands down, the best Harry Potter game made so far. Despite all the controversy, we as gamers have to appreciate the time and effort that went into this masterpiece. Beginning character customization does fall a bit short with few choices and not a lot of room to customize your features, but by far the story makes up for it all. You gather more cosmetics throughout the game and you can change how you look no matter how far into the story you are. I was also able to switch between keyboard and controller without any issues at all. There are a few bugs in the game, but nothing too noticeable on my end. I could say so much more about how great this game is so far, but it's better if you check it out yourself. I highly recommend this game to any who grew up with the nostalgic of the Wizarding world or a big fan of fantasy RPG.Well, I'm back to defense against the dark arts class now. Gotta get my fellow Slytherin more points so we can get that House Cup. :)

author: Denai
review: Кайфушная история. Возможно игра года.Если фантастические твари понравились, то и тут будет приятно играть. Ходишь по замку и деревням, трогаешь всякие летающие топоры, кнопки, животных, разрушенные стауи, говорящие цветы, летающие мётлы, живые картины, поющие кусты, котов, чужие сундуки и т.п. Всё звучит, шевелится и радует глаз. Именно в звук много атмосферы уходит, но не сказать что он тут какой-то особенный. Нормальный звук.С контроллера играть удобно. Мало тактильной отдачи.  Ужаснейшее управление полётами (с клавомыши тоже ужасное).  Мне гораздо удобнее с контроллера, чем с мышью.На Ultrawide опять не всё хорошо. Катсцены с рамочкам. Но не бесит и катсцен таких не особо много. Многое косое кривое поправимо апдейтами, надеюсь их завезут.Есть баги. Есть проседания ФПС, думаю и на 4090 будут. АЛЯРМ, ИГРА НЕ ОПТИМИЗИРОВАНА!!111!11адин111На 3070 идёт на высоких с просадками, при этом игра очень надеется что в видеокарте 15ГБ+ памяти и очень печалится, когда их не находит. На Linux не работают Reflex, лучи и  некоторые моменты про DLSS. Ну и лица опять пожёваные на не-винде, что категорически говорит что для игры понадобится windows. Прогрузки комнат бесят, что мешает повесить триггер загрузки за 3 метра до двери - искренне не понимаю.Картинка не то чтоб прям воу, но хорошая. На 4 из 5. Лицевая анимация на 2.5 из 5. Диалоги местами занудные, но если бегать по миру и всё кругом трогать, то не особо бесят этим.Бои крайне приятные. Вообще боёвка самая интересная за пару последних лет. Бонусы предзаказа не нужны (кроме арены, арена прикольная). Гайды из интернетов читать не рекомендую, очень приятно делать открытия самостоятельно.Экипровка в игре - самый вялый (первых 20% игры уж точно) аспект. Сделано для галочки, ну и для внешки.Трансформеров знаменитых увидите в количестве одной штуки раза полтора за игру (пока видел 1 раз по сюжету чисто для галочки и 1 раз аж 3 строки текста на побочном задании, за которое ничего дельного не дают)Можно гладить кошекМожно завести собственных нюхлей, но пока не нашёл где их пойматьКорованы грабить вроде как нельзя

It provided that bit of nostalgia of being a kid and going to see the harry potter movies in theaters. Id say its worth it but who am I.

author: Shigawire
review: I'm not a Harry Potter fan per-se. But I was looking forward to this because of the developer Avalanche. This is indeed a VERY excellent open-world adventure, with *tons* of well designed magic. Pros: The atmosphere of everything is very magical. Magic spells are very well designed and make for some fun puzzles and very well balanced for combat.Combat itself is also very well designed, where every spell has a function depending on the enemy or situation. Not super hard, perhaps a bit too easy on Normal (when compared to fex God of War, which has a lot harder boss fights). I would probably recommend Hard on your playthrough.The main story is well written and engaging. You always want to know what happens next.Cons: There were some major performance issues on launch (3080 Ti here), should get better with patches.Some of the facial and gesture animations look a bit underwhelming (when for example compared to God of War or Heavy Rain).A lot of the puzzles were a bit too easy to figure out.9/10

author: Lorule Waifu
review: ---{ Graphics }---☐ You forget what reality is☑ Beautiful☐ Good☐ Decent☐ Bad☐ Don‘t look too long at it☐ MS-DOS---{ Gameplay }---☑ Very good☐ Good☐ It's just gameplay☐ Mehh☐ Watch paint dry instead☐ Just don't---{ Audio }---☐ Eargasm☑ Very good☐ Good☐ Not too bad☐ Bad☐ I'm now deaf---{ Audience }---☐ Kids☐ Teens☐ Adults☐ Grandma---{ PC Requirements }---☐ Check if you can run paint☐ Potato☐ Decent☐ Fast☑ Rich boi☐ Ask NASA if they have a spare computer---{ Difficulty }---☐ Just press 'W'☐ Easy☐ Easy to learn / Hard to master☑ Significant brain usage☐ Difficult☐ Dark Souls---{ Grind }---☐ Nothing to grind☐ Only if u care about leaderboards/ranks☑ Isn't necessary to progress☐ Average grind level☐ Too much grind☐ You'll need a second life for grinding---{ Story }---☐ No Story☐ Some lore☐ Average☐ Good☐ Lovely☑ It'll replace your life---{ Game Time }---☐ Long enough for a cup of coffee☐ Short☐ Average☑ Long☐ To infinity and beyond---{ Price }---☐ It's free!☑ Worth the price☐ If it's on sale☐ If u have some spare money left☐ Not recommended☐ You could also just burn your money---{ Bugs }---☐ Never heard of☑ Minor bugs☐ Can get annoying☐ ARK: Survival Evolved☐ The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs---{ ? / 10 }---☐ 1☐ 2☐ 3☐ 4☐ 5☐ 6☐ 7☐ 8☑ 9.5☐ 10I'm very impressed with this game.  I had high expectations but it honestly surpassed that.  There is the main plot but lots of side quests. (I'm a sides quest gal).  The area is fairly large.  I've played it for 12 hours so far and only barely touched on the map.  I'm still constantly getting lost in Hogwarts as you can explore every nook and cranny.  It brings the enviroments of the movie to the game, but also takes some things from the books (such as Peeves) to fill in the gaps.  I was surprised how you can wander everywhere.  Go from green house to kitchen, to library to classrooms to bathrooms.  I think the moving stairs was clever how they did it so it didnt impede progress.  The ability to fly far and wide is amazing.  Going from Hogsmead to landing on one of the bridges inside Hogwarts to stroll around the castle feels seamless to me.  I have yet to get into the beasts portion of the game as I've been doing side quests and exploring.I found the world building amazing.  I love the tiny details of paintings moving, statues watching you, house elves cleaning and disappearing.  Listening to conversations that dont affect the plot but dont sound out of place, and the amount of work in the BG NPCs that you cant interact with, they have nothing to do with the story, but living their lives and you get a peek into it with their interactions. I will say the combat was initially too challenging for me.  I found trying to juggle all the keys (going from numbers to ctrl, space, mouse and arrows) while trying to watch for attacks and counter spells a bit overwhelming.  They let you change the difficulty setting but not so much allow you to rebind the keys, which would be a nice QOL.There are a few minor things so far, glitches, and also not explaining how the clothing/gear (how to change its appearance) was lacking, but it doesnt bother the game play at all. I know a lot of people do not want to support the game because of politics and peer pressure.  I respect that.  I myself was gifted this game, but if I wasn't I probably would've still purchased it.  It really does the world of Harry Potter justice, and the team at Avalanche clearly love the source material and did it justice.

author: Eritheus
review: Too long dont want to read: The game feels heavily unfinished, with no mini games at all, no quiddidtch, no deep and varied npcs to interact from and with. They are all lifeless and empty. There are no school life or consequences for what you do, you can just go to the forbidden forest and its that, you can roam the castle at night and be consequence free, your character has ABSOLUTELY NO BACKGROUND WHATSOEVER. every decision you make has no branch path at all.NOW IF YOU WANT TO READ.THIS GAME IS CRUEL, ITS A MOCKERY, IT IS SOMETHING MADE BY A COMPANY THAT DESPITE SAYING IT HAS LOVE FOR THE UNIVERSE OF HARRY POTTER, DOES NOT HAVE IT AT ALL AND IT SHOWS WITH EVERY SINGLE MINOR THING THAT WAS IGNORED.THE GAME FEELS ABSOLUTELY EMPTY DESPITE THE FEATURES THEY TRIED HARD TO PUT IN THE GAME. IT FEELS EMPTY, DEVOID OF JOY, LIFE AND INTERACTION. THERE ARE NO CLASSES OUTSIDE OF THE MAINQUEST, THERE ARE NO SCHEDULES FOR A STUDENT, NO CONSEQUENCE IN MISSING CLASSES, NO CONSEQUENCES FOR YOUR ACTIONS, IT FEELS LIKE THEY TRIED HARD TO BE AS VAGUE AND GENERIC AS POSSIBLE ABOUT EVERY ASPECT OF YOUR CHARACTER IN THE GAME. THE MAIN STORY IS CRUDE, IT GIVES NO PLAYER MOTIVATION. THE COMPANIONS? WAY TOO FEW IN NUMBER OR INTERESTING ENOUGH TO MAKE YOU CARE ABOUT THEM OR BE CURIOUS ABOUT THEM.THE RELATIONSHIP WITH YOUR COLEAGUES AND TEACHERS IS SHALLOW AND COMPLETELY DEVOID OF ANYTHING OTHER THAN THE MAIN QUEST RAILROADING YOU.EVERY SINGLE MOMENT I SPENT PLAYING THIS GAME THAT I BOUGHT WITH MY HARD EARNED MONEY, I EVEN GOT THE COLLECTORS ED. WAS SPENT HOPING IT WOULD GET BETTER. ITS A SHALLOW GAME, WITH SHALLOW FEATURES, WITH SHALLOW CHARACTERS.IT HAS GOOD GRAPHICS, BUT THAT MY FRIEND, IN OUR DAY AND AGE, FOR A TRIPLE A GAME, IS NOTHING MORE THAN THE EXPECTED.WHAT BOTHERS ME THE MOST IS THE FACT THAT THERE IS NOT A SIMPLE ATRIBUTE SYSTEM IN PLACE TO DETERMINE WICH SUBJECTS YOU EXCELL AT, NOTHING TO SAY THAT YOU ARE BETTER AT POTIONS THAN TRANSFIGURATION AND SO ON. ANOTHER THING THAT BOTHERS ME IS THE FACT THAT YOU CANT CHOOSE YOUR BACKGROUND, WHO YOU ARE, WHERE DO YOU COME FROM AND WHO ARE YOUR PARENTS, IF YOU HAVE ANY. THE SHEER LACK OF POLISHING SHOWS TO ME THAT THIS IS IN THE ESSENCE, JUST A MID GAME, AT BEST. WE WORK SO MUCH FOR OUR MONEY, WE ARE WORTH MORE THAN THIS.

author: Nox
review: Amazing - This game has a bit of something for everyone. Open world exploration, lots of collectibles, secret & puzzle solving, engaging spell slinging fights, customizable build load outs based on player preferences, immersive story, full voice acting with a ton of attention to detail to make the surroundings feel alive, and a lot more I'm sure I'm forgetting.In most games that have attempted such a broad scope of design when integrating many systems and lore from source material together, I would have expected the pieces to break at the seams, but somehow this game still delivers a cohesive, fun experience and stays true to the source material. Not only does it nod to many smaller references from the books and movies, but expands on the world building - setting the stage for potentially more cannon material in the Wizarding World.My favorite discovery so far has been a brewing pot in the last stall in one of the lavatories, one of many small bits of fun you'll encounter while exploring the castle. Even for those unfamiliar with the world, there is a ton to bite into. If you're a fan of exploration and open world RPGs with many side quests and mini games, you'll thoroughly enjoy this game.The first HP game ever released was very well received, but followed a myriad of half baked sequels that each drifted further away from the original vision. Hogwart's Legacy has brought back the original intent into an era that made it technically feasible to support such an ambitious vision. I can't wait to see what they end up doing for DLCs or a sequel.

author: gladosforlife
review: this game is not like persona. i saw some criticisms like "we have no weekly schedule of magic classes", so i wanted to put these aside quickly.look  at this game as if an old school console title was made with the modern technology - that's pretty much what happened.let's go through the bad stuff first.yes, there are no real consequences of your choices and there are no multiple endings.  this is also not a "story rich" game. you a playing as a chosen one who has no background. despite being a school student you will do lots of quests like "go KILL some bad people/goblins/trolls" etc, and you will do that without remorse, although you still can't become a dark lord. yes, there are maybe too many mini-games for my liking.my main criticism is that some game mechanics are introduced too late. you are progressing not through mob grind, but through quests and exploring. and you need to know lots of spells just to discover everything. especially frustrating one is lockpicking. who decided that it would be fun to make it available fully after completing 3-staged quest, that needs dozens of items, randomly smeared by the map? i am sorry, but this is insane. i heard that this developer never made games like this before, so i guess they are trying stuff, and threw together too many "gamifications" from different genres if you will. the lockpicking does not have to be achieved this difficultly and it does not need to be a minigame. crafting does not need to have a craft time, you are not doing a gacha for smartphones. i hope the next game by this developer will improve in this regard.now for the good stuff!oh yeah, despite these inconveniences this game really delivers. this is indeed a hogwarts experience.they replicated the castle from the movies as it was seen there to the last bit. there are no copy-paste locations, no lazy textures. every room, every last ladder is made with love and care, and you can travel where ever you want. 10/10 hogwarts virtual tour!they actually read the books and knew lore well. the more you are exploring, the more little things you will find, even if something was mentioned in the books once, you probably will find a reference in this game (keeping in mind the pre-grindewald timeline of course)you can fly. you have a broom and you can fly almost everywhere, including above the hogwarts castle itself. closest experience to that was probably when you finally managed to craft a long lasting flying potion in morrowind. here you don't need a consumable, just sit on a broom and gothe combat is FUN. you have so many things to chose from during the battle, you can combine pretty much every spell you know at the moment, and yes, this does includes the forbidden ones. you will get the room of requirement and you will have a chance to conjure it how ever you like it. this game feels like it was loved, the amount of work they did is really showing.this is not an early access, it is not broken and beside a couple of minor hiccups it just works, which nowadays is refreshing. this is a perfect escapism title, if you are tired and sad, grab your broom and go, adventures are ahead!p.s. you can pet all the cats. the best girl is professor garlic

author: ShadowOfHistory
review: Good? Bad? Honestly, this game is even hard to rate. This is purely visual tourism generic open world game, you seen them many times. I bet you can slap ubisoft logo and nobody will even notice. That said... Sometimes having a good "game" is not required for a good "product". Hogwarts Legacy is an OUTSTANDING eye candy for everyone even vaguely interested or aware of H.P. universe and it's hard to walk for ten minutes without that pleased grin, noticing as portraits ask you to shut down your Lumos at night or other neat details. Game looks good, and combat/exploration/story, while being terribly generic, do not detract from the overall experience. + A good H.P. game. + Atmosphere and details. - Facial animations and voice acting at times. - Eh, generic open world quest markers, you know them. - No quidditch.- Broom controls are so bad that no quidditch is almost a +. - Pre-order bonus, deluxe edition bonus, link to some 3rd party website bonus, twitch drop bonus, CAN MODERN DEVS ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ STOP PUTTING EXTRINSIC REWARDS INTO SOLO RPG bonus.

author: mewingtons
review: One of the best adventure games out there right now, comparable to the level of exploration as the Red Dead Redemption series. The team who worked on this did a solid job on the world with a tremendous amount of details. The whole environment seems alive with interactivity, and the scenery is beautiful. The moving pictures, the various dialogue interactions and events, the little items you can move, etc. all come together to create a truly unique experience and makes it feel like you are really part of the Harry Potter universe. Also, the fact that you can roam around Hogwarts castle and the surrounding areas without loading screens is a great touch that makes you just want to explore and helps to not break the immersion. There is so much to do and see with story quests and side quests available, as well as dungeons, puzzles, item collection, customization, and different scenarios for each house, which adds to the replayability. Even more, no pay-to-win or DLC microtransactions to ruin the experience. So far, the game has run without any hiccups or bugs after about 10 hours of gameplay. I can honestly say I am happy to have spent the money on this game and feel I have gotten my money's worth, as recent games have been lackluster to disappointing overall. Hogwarts Legacy has really set the bar about how games should be released.10 Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans out of 10

author: inDe_eD
review: Yes. Especially if you like Harry Potter universe. Worth playingWhen this game was announced, I was immediately excited. I am a big fan of the Harry Potter franchise, and although I'm aware this takes place in a completely different time, and is more-so a spinoff / extended universe / lore game, it still had my attention. The game was delayed a few times, but I'm okay with that if it means a more polished product. I pre-ordered it and played it for the 72 hours early access for deluxe edition pre-order buyers. I am not finished with the game after ~25 hours (I am about 55% total completion as of writing this review), but I am definitely enjoying my time and have little to no complaints. Also, figured I would mention that I am very experienced with this style of game, and have likely completed a lot more than the average person may have in those hours. I am focusing side / exploration missions first, story after.I absolutely love the combat in this game. It is intense, and there is so much going on but it doesn't overwhelm you or require you to be an expert at games. There are 'ultimates' (in a sense, they aren't actually called that in-game), and you can even interact with the environment and control some of the environment while battling enemies as well, to keep you entertained.The exploration is reminiscent to that of the first 3 Harry Potter games on PC, allowing you to walk all through the castle (which is absolutely gigantic, by the way), as well as outside of Hogwarts grounds, up in the mountains and hills. Outside, you can also fly around on your broom (after a certain point early in the game), making it that much better.There are lots of missions and collectables and things to unlock throughout the game. This is nothing new per se, as it is just like the Far Cry games, however I am a completionist, and love to try and finish every single thing. Some of the more mundane collectables are also useful because they can unlock extra outfit overrides and outfit perks after collecting certain amounts of them.By all means, the story isn't a crazy, 'new' story. It follows a certain trope () but it isn't annoying or horribly boring like Borderlands 3 was (for me). So it's good, but it's nothing we haven't  seen before.There are levels, skills (referred to as 'talents'), perks and stats for your clothing pieces (same idea as Cyberpunk), upgrades to the broom, upgrades to clothing, clothing rarities / qualities, etc.The graphics are great! It's not groundbreaking, but definitely great to look at, inside the castle especially. It is all I ever wanted when I was a kid, but unfortunately that was not possible back then.Choosing your own House at Hogwarts does have some effect on your gameplay. Many missions and side missions are different, each house has their own common room, and things can play out slightly differently. It's no 'Detroit Become Human', but there was at least some attempt, which I like to see.Choosing your wand length, wood, inner core, your house, patronus, and all that was cool to do. Even though it doesn't really affect anything, your wand you don't really often see up close, it's still fun for those who are very into the franchise.As mentioned before, lots of the side missions and exploration tasks can get repetitive in nature, though they are all physically different, the idea is the same. Doesn't bother me, but could bother some. If you've played Far Cry, it's the same deal. For me, I couldn't care less about this. However, I can't deny it; the mouth animations when someone is speaking is  a few years behind.You may not experience any, however I have experienced things such as falling through the world randomly,  and almost getting stuck in certain areas in the highlands while trying to get into areas on my broom, but it's mostly my fault because I was trying to cheese the game. I have not encountered any softlock issues, any horrible game-breaking bugs, just some minor issues, none of which directly affected me really at all.As an example, in shops, where you can sell your clothing pieces (basically your armour), if you have like 20 pieces you want to sell, you can't select all, or even just click once to sell an item. They have a preventative measure in place so that you don't accidentally sell something you want to keep (because you can't buy things back), meaning I have to hold left-click on each item (could be upwards of 30 items if I have a full inventory) for about 1.5s. Not that big of a deal, but if they allowed you to buy-back or even do a sell-all or multi-select, it'd be a lot better. Another example is the character creation screen. Who in the world thought that a slider (with no images for reference) for hair colour was a good idea?! You can't simply pick a color, or have a gradient bar to see what colour you're selecting. You have to sit there and scroll through a slider bar with about 25 different colours and just try to remember which one you liked most. You can see the preview on your character but good luck remember what specific selection on the line was the one you wanted. There are a few other small issues like that, mostly based on preference and my playstyle, but in my own opinion I think there are a few overlooked UI / developer choice issues that could be made a lot better. .Do I recommend it? Yes! It is fun, entertaining, though nothing groundbreaking. It is a  win for Harry Potter fans, as they haven't had a game in like 10 years and the last 3 entries were horrendously bad. I am a huge fan of the first 3 games, as I grew up with those, and this is like a modern take on them, and I could not be happier. The game isn't as demanding as some in terms of computer power, which is another bonus.

author: Johnny-Drama
review: I cannot recommend this game enough. Every time I feel like I've seen the best thing in this game's world, it keeps surprising me. As a fan of this series, the DEVELOPERS have absolutely outdone themselves. The moment I walked into the Room of Requirement, it was as if they had pulled the visions from my mind. It was perfect. The attention to detail from the dining room to Hogsmeade are beyond words. What's even better are the house common rooms, two of which we never saw in the movies. My wife is playing Ravenclaw and WOW that common room's details are astounding.The story is intriguing, the battle system is awesome and feels like the quick, fast-paced action we saw in the movies. Flying is a bit wonky, but you do get better. Overall, I was not expecting this game to be as BIG as it is, the world map is massive. It's fun to play, rewarding to search and discover secrets, it really is everything a Potter fan would want.For those slamming the game because of JK Rowling, look, she's filthy rich, whether you buy this game or not, it won't affect her life at all. On the flip side, there are literally hundreds of people who worked over 5 years to make this game a dream come true. You buying the game says thank you to them, keeps them employed and rewards their hard work.On top of that the devs even included a trans-character in the game for good measure and a proper "EFF" you to JK Rowling. So don't trash this game in review bombs because of her, stand with it and the inclusion of a trans character, but more importantly, support the developers for making a game so accurate to the world, that blows the mind.

author: Qwa
review: Steam Deck runs this game. That's what an AAA RPG should be in terms of density - world size is proportional to its content.Not like those claims of huge games with huge worlds and no content - like Ubisoft and other "indie" companies love to boast about.

author: Sammy the Wizard
review: After over 60 hours with Hogwarts Legacy, I have beaten the main story, done all the side quests, and found many of the collectibles. It may not be the RPG they marketed it as, but it is still a fantastic game. With no real class selection, choices that matter, or build variety to find, it's hard to call Hogwarts Legacy an RPG, even if it has a few light RPG elements. Unfortunately, these days it seems that any game with even the slightest hint of an RPG element is marketed as an RPG and Hogwarts Legacy does manage to be a fantastic open world action adventure game, so I cannot say I am overly disappointed or surprised.At it’s core, Hogwarts Legacy is a very standard open world action adventure game. If you are not a fan of AAA open world games, you’re probably not going to like this. It doesn’t really do much that is unique or different other than being set in a really cool fantasy world with an amazing castle and executing the formula very well. It does have performance issues, especially in Hogwarts and Hogsmead, but they were not enough to ruin my enjoyment. When the game is not having a lag attack, it runs pretty good.After a decently long and super cool introduction, you enter Hogwarts as a 5th year student. The castle really does feel magical and maze like. Between the early game quests that take place in the castle and all the collectibles and loot scattered about, I spent the majority of my first 10 hours inside the castle. There really is just that much to see and do inside the castle, but this did lead to a few balance issues. Early game I was swapping out ever single piece of gear 3 to 5 times between each combat encounter, and when I finally met my first boss, I was way over levelled.I really appreciate that each piece of gear you get is saved as a skin that you can apply to any piece of gear of the same type. There is a pretty good variety of skins, although most of the shirts seem to have a very blue colour pallet, maybe because that is my house colours. Like most games with character customization, you pretty much end up standing out in a crowd. You do have a pair of default house robes that you can wear, but that’s boring. It would be nice to see NPCs change their clothes, especially when not in Hogwarts, or when the seasons change. It is a little odd being the only one wearing a scarf and gloves during the winter.Something I find really impressive is how the game handles loading. Every door seems to be a sometimes not so hidden loading screen. For the most part doors just swing open as you walk into them, making for a completely seamless experience while traversing the world, including Hogwarts castle itself. Sometimes the game does not load quick enough and a small loading circle appears by the door handle. This never lasts for more than a few seconds, so when it works, its amazing, and when it doesn’t, it’s not even a minor annoyance. Combine this with the fact that you can use your broom from courtyards inside the castle and directly fly to areas outside the castle, and the game feels open in a way that other open world games don’t. For some reason, there are some outdoor areas of Hogwarts, and the entire village of Hogsmead, where you can not use your broom.The game consists of doing main quests, which often take you to very cool locations, side quests, which are fairly standard, and assignments for your professors, which teach you new spells. The main quests and side quests are usually pretty interesting, although some side quests don’t even try to hide the fact that they are fetch quests. The assignments do often feel like fetch quests with no real story attached. You do gain new spells from assignments, so at least you get a good reward for doing them. The game is not going to win any awards for writing, but it is good enough to keep my interested.The game does a good job of slowly introducing you to new mechanics so that you never feel overwhelmed, but at times it does feel like things are introduced too slowly. Most of the mechanics are pretty neat, but many of them feel they could have a bit more polish. Broom flying is very nice, even if the controls are not the most intuitive. The Room of Requirements is super cool, even if what they call green is more of a teal and placing items is a bit awkward. The most notable bad mechanic is lock picking. I really do not like the lock picking mini game in this game. It is not explained well, its not fun, its animations are much longer than they need to be, and it feels out of place. I’m using magic to unlock the lock, not picking it, so why is there a lock picking mini game?The combat, on the other hand, is great. This is some of the best combat I’ve seen from a game that is not a shooter. You have a good amount of spell variety. Spells feel impactful and powerful, although mid game enemies do get a bit tanky. Blocking and dodging feels good. I do wish you could have more than 4 spells on your spell bar at a time. It’s not a huge deal to switch spell bars with my mouse wheel, but with so many easily accessible unused keys on my keyboard, it would be nice if I could use some of them. It would also be nice if the Room of Requirement spells were on a dedicated spell bar that only shows up inside upon entering so that they do not take up space on your regular spell bar.Outside Hogwarts, you have a fairly standard open world with collectibles, towns, puzzles, loot, caves, bandit camps, etc. I would say the world is a bit above average, but I also really like fantasy and fantasy environments. The world is not the biggest world I’ve ever seen, but it does not need to be. I would much rather have a small and dense world than a large and sparse one. Hogwarts Legacy is decently dense and the open world activities are fun and varied enough. I thought I would not do them all, but then I checked and noticed I only had a small handful left, so I ended up finishing them off.Something I find very odd is that many of the ruins and bandit camps have mini puzzles to get their loot. These puzzles are very simple and consist of things like moving some objects and doing a bit of parkour. The thing I find most strange is that you're a wizard with a flying broom. Most of the time these puzzles can be entirely ignored if you just take out your broom and fly to the loot. It just feels very odd that they would spend time making all of thees tiny puzzles that can easily be avoided. It feels like they forgot that flying was a thing.In my playtime I have not had many bugs, unless you count lag and frame dips to be bugs. The worst bug was when I randomly fell through the world. Then I remembered I was a wizard with a magical broom, so I flew back up and continued as if nothing had happened. I’ve also had a few floating objects that were clearly bugs and not part of the games magic, and a texture issues.Hogwarts Legacy may not be anything groundbreaking, but it is a fantastic game and other than performance issues, my only complaints are very nit-picky, like the Room of Requirements not having a proper green or lock picking being very annoying. The story is interesting, the characters are decent, the world is truly magical, the music is great, and the combat is fun. There is not a lot more you could ask for.

author: Renegoddess
review: Awalnya sangat meragu sama game ini sampe sempat 2x refund beli yang regular edition. Terus kemarin tanggal 10 februari juga banyak SJW di discussion forumsnya jadi makin ragu sama gamenya tapi emang intuisi tidak bisa diragukan karena dari awal emang liat gamenya kok kek yg bagus gitu ya, pas udah jamnya early access jadi tangan sangat gatak buat beli alhasil beli lagi untuk ke 3 kalinya tapi yang Deluxe Edition biar sekalian bisa download duluan mumpung Wifi di Thailand kemarin lagi bagus bagusnya.Ternyata gamenya keren abies, biasanya main Fallout atau Elder Scroll itu agak cepet bosen karena walaupun seru tapi rasanya sangat datar aja gitu seru yang buat saya 2 jam perhari udah cukup.Tapi somehow ini game emang bener2 nagih. Explorasi dan vibes tiap region itu bener bener beda. Dari Hogwarts yang bener bener wah ancient abis, Hogsmade yang bener2 homy and cozy, terus Forbiden Forest yang bener2 vibesnya terlarang banget itu bener bener point utama yg gabikin nyesel keluar duit hampir sejuta buat game ini. Walaupun memang variasi musuhnya terkesan repetitive tapi explorasi, view, dan vibesnya yang bikin saya nyaman sama game ini. Dan ya memang tidak ada game yg sempurna ya bund, kadang lagi asik asik liat pemandangan tau tau fps drop dari 50 ke 30 tapi selebihnya itu lancar dan masih sangat playable buat dinikmati. Dialogue scenenya juga udah di set jadi NPCnya ga bener bener random penempatannya, sangat bagus banget drpd Fallout yang kadang kalau kita maksa buat ngobrol tau tau ngebug entah kemana.Overall ini game 9/10 buat gamer seperti diri saya yang suka cepet bosen sama gamenya, sayang aja ada bbrp hal kaya Quiditch dll yang entah tidak di implementasikan atau belum di implementasikan, harapannya cuma kalau bisa ini game ada ekspansi lebih via DLC baik kelanjutan cerita ataupun fitur multiplayer/ local coop karena somehow battle sendirian rasanya agak hampa dan terlalu OP. Mungkin kalau ada fitur companion seperti Fallout dan Elder Scroll bakalan lebih immersive, tapi ya we know its a different developer. Anyway , i still dont want to complete the main story as a Ravenclaw, because the house have many and long sidequest that i wanted to explore first rather than completing the main story, because why not.

author: ColdBeer
review: Is this the Harry Potter game you always wanted? . I still can't believe that, but it  is!After all these years, after so many disappointments, we actually have a survivor of the hype train! Absolutely 10/10. Just like your sister.

author: DestinySlayer96
review: Based off my first impressions after playing ten hours, I am very much enjoying Hogwarts Legacy. It feels like a love letter to the Harry Potter Universe and there are so many little details that make the world feel alive. Combat is punchy and fun. The visuals are gorgeous and nostalgic. If you enjoy intensely fun magic combat and exploring a fleshed-out fantasy world that's overloaded with the mystical and magical, you'll love this game. If you're already a huge Harry Potter fan, this game was made for you.Now, I cannot say the game is in a perfect state right now, as that'd be dishonest. I received the early access copy as I'd pre-ordered the Deluxe edition. My computer specs are:- RTX 3060- i5-12600k- 16 GB 3600 MHz DDR4 RAM- NVMEWith those specs, playing at Ultra settings at 1080p with DLSS Quality and no Raytracing, the game has been playing at 75 fps (my monitor's native refresh rate) with dips into the 60s here and there. At High settings, my fps was pretty darn steady. As many others have mentioned, the PC version is plagued by stuttering issues. Even tweaking my settings down to medium or lower does not solve them. Hopefully a day one patch solves this. It's really my only complaint.Despite that, though, I've been very much enjoying my time with Hogwarts Legacy. Once some patches roll out for PC, I think my rating would bump up from an 8/10 to a 10/10. I'll update my review if my opinion changes as I continue through the story.Now, if you excuse me, this Hufflepuff needs to get back to her classes ;)

author: Zylo
review: Get ready cause this is a long one, might even want to grab yourself a cup of coffeeAs a fan of the Harry Potter series, I was excited to play Hogwarts Legacy, and I have to say, I wasn't disappointed. The game offers a vast, detailed, and impressive recreation of Hogwarts and its neighboring regions, which is packed to the brim with locations to discover, collectibles, and activities to clear. For a Potterhead like me, it was a dream come true.The combat system in the game is varied and satisfying. As I learned new spells, new combat opportunities opened up, which kept the game fresh and engaging in the long run. The customization possibilities are also excellent, featuring a myriad of cosmetics and skins, and my own customizable 'base' to furnish by hand at leisure.The progression system in Hogwarts Legacy portrays my growth as a wizard quite well, giving me new tools and utilities to access previously-locked content and areas. I also liked the solid roster of side characters; most of them are likable/unique enough, and their writing isn't complete garbage.However, the game is not without its issues. One major issue is the excessively repetitive open-world activities that create bloat and annoyance for those who want to complete all side activities. Additionally, combat balance issues with potions, 'healing spam,' and unforgivable curses make most fights quite too easy, especially when upgraded.Another problem is that most named foes and quest bosses are just normal enemies on steroids, with no variation in mechanics and no unique behaviors. I also noticed some inconsistencies with lore and character behavior. For example, if I used unforgivable curses in public or during quests (with witnesses), nobody seemed to give a damn.Moreover, I experienced significant frame-drops inside Hogwarts when transitioning between different sections and in specific places throughout the castle, regardless of settings. In some cases, fall damage doesn't even register on enemies.Overall, it took me 42 hours to complete Hogwarts Legacy, taking considerable extra time to clear all optional content and find around 90% of collectibles/secrets on Hard difficulty. However, I don't see a reason to replay the game once finished, except for achievement hunting, as the content is linear.Despite its flaws, I think Hogwarts Legacy is worth buying, especially if you're a fan of the saga. The amount of content and quality are more than fair for the proposed $60 price, expected from an AAA release.In conclusion, Hogwarts Legacy is by far the best game ever made based on this franchise, but it's not a masterpiece by any means. Fans of the series will almost certainly like it, but it's still drawn back by its issues.

author: Erebus
review: Very little was known about this game over the entire course of its development, and you can tell now playing this game that it was nothing but a passion project. Everything in this game is beyond amazing and stunning between the visuals the game play and everything in between. Even if you're not a fan of the Harry Potter universe, this game will blow your mind.

author: Saint Aaron
review: I was very skeptical before the release of this game. They were very upfront about what the game looked like and what it would contain, but still with being burned recently by so many games, I was still weary. I can now say with full confidence that it’s absolutely fantastic! They have crafted a world that feels so alive and so true to the source material. The inside of Hogwarts is an absolute masterpiece. I can say with confidence it is the best interior structure I have seen ever built in a video game. Every time you turn the corner, you will see another scene from the movies or books that you recognize!
