author: lafaman
review: Amazing game, must play, I thought I would not like it, but now I wish the story was longer

author: Turrim
review: From the few hours played until now, Hogwarts Legacy is pretty much the evolution that everyone that played the older and earlier games in the series always hoped that they would just have kept creating games in this vein and direction.You are free to explore the Hogwarts castle plus all surrounding grounds and even going to Hogsmeade, it starts with a strong narrative and freedom in which you can do quests, go to classes to learn new spells, do some puzzles, read some trivia, create your wand, fly around, etc. All of this accompanied with some great graphics (hopefully the upcoming patches/drivers will improve performance) and beautiful music that while new sounds that it came straight from the main series.Looking forward to keep exploring the grounds and all secrets plus to see how the main story unfolds.

author: Mlemlom
review: Overall, this game won't do anything you haven't seen before already, mechanically.  I'd say the actual weakest part of the game is the actual gameplay, although it is entertaining enough to carry itself.  Most of the enjoyment I've had so far has been from exploration, which is something I look forward to in everything I play.The character customization is not what I'd consider good, although it's probably acceptable for most.  There seems to be a wide variety of different clothing options that you find regularly, and (having tested on two different saves) the loot is randomized.  The shaders on the hair are absolutely awful, and despite spending quite a while sifting through them and looking at them in different lighting environments, never found anything that looked good.  There seems to be something... wrong with many of the faces and eyes, particularly the girls, to me.The story (which I am not far into) seems intriguing enough, typical fantasy spiel, as you might imagine for the genre.  Many of the character voices are somewhat unusual, even jarring, at times.  When not over-acting, there's a serious "robotic" voice / pitch issue for both the player character and NPCs at times.  The lip syncing is quite unnatural and distracted me at times, as well as the strange empty eyes that most NPCs have.The combat is what I'd consider "rock, paper, scissors" combat.  You need to cast the right type of spell, generally noted by its colour, to break certain defenses which also share the colour of the spell type that must break them.  While it is not difficult even on hard difficulty, it can be very fast-paced and reaction-heavy when fighting multiple enemies.  That alone makes the combat pretty engaging, but there is no real depth or complexity I can note beyond this.This title is certainly not worth the listing price and if you are dead set on getting it, wait for sales... or perhaps pursue a more morally acceptable avenue of acquisition.  I can certainly see it becoming a micro-transaction hell in the future.It is not a terrible game and is more good than bad, on those terms.  Nostalgia will certainly be a winning factor for many fans of the series, and I suspect that is a large catalyst for its seemingly overall success.  Suffice to say, the thick controversy over this title does it absolutely no favours.  The way some of the more sensitive subjects are handled in-game feels like something between a haphazardly forced afterthought and a poor joke that leaves the entire room uncomfortable.  The more I progress through the game, the more I find myself thinking these instances were not mistakes.Speaking purely from a reviewer's standpoint on a game, I cannot see it being worth the price.  It's not ground-breaking, it's not amazing, and does nothing new for the open world genre.  It's not terrible, but it's not "overwhelmingly" and "positively" good, to me, at least.  As it stands now I cannot really recommend it, especially concerning the price and what you get for the content, not counting moral / ethical reasons.I'm sure nobody has come to the review section to hear my personal feelings on the controversies involved, so all I'll say is:Some of the behaviors I have seen absolutely disgust me.  Y'all need to do better.Be better.

author: Mommy Ahri
review: This is easily going to be the Best Game Of The Year! I played since 7th Feb (The Early acces) The game have unlimited of hours of game play. Not only a good main story but 100's of side quests and secret quests. In the castle and outside you will also find riddles and secret places to explore. This is legit the best game i have played since i started playing League Of Legends in 2010! Just a miracle game!

author: Medium-Rare Lethargy
review: The first few hours of this game felt so full of life, so inexplicably exciting; I really felt hooked. Unfortunately, the 'magic' only lasts for so long. The remainder of the game is persistently dull.   Every puzzle mechanic or setting that is briefly interesting seem to only have been used as a little feather to tickle our noses with, it's just disappointing to see the amount of obvious love that has gone into many parts of the world go to waste because this overblown officially licensed fan fiction tries to reach it's fingers into too many pies. I don't even want to really get into how uncanny it is that in spite of anything our character does in the story or side, the worst consequence you can really get is a bit of sass or a mild scolding.   Most folks probably don't expect anything mindblowing from this game, perhaps they just wanna explore the recesses of their nostalgia within the recesses of Hogwarts. This game DOES encourage exploration, and the castle truly IS beautifully made and presented. However, the way they encourage exploration is a far cry from being engaging in any sense of the word. Spamming REVELIO as I jaunt through the halls, it really takes away from much of the sense of amazement I reckon I would have if these areas were presented to us in a different context. Our introductions to the various classes of Hogwarts are an adequate example of that being done, of exploring the god forsaken castle through the inquisitive eyes of our youthful protagonist and their peers. It's a crying shame these classes are only one-offs and the rest of the game is so much more focused on other parts of the world it's a wonder that they felt the need to include the school at all.   Also ♥♥♥♥ the vapid ♥♥♥♥ JKR, donate to charity  if you're up to it.

author: Nyarlathotep
review: 10/10 Clearly in my top 5 list of favorite games of all time, the world 10/10  Insane there are details everywhere every detail you seen in the movies, oh yeah its there!The gameplay 10/10   Such a smooth gameplay the combat feels rewarding and challenging to!! you gotta react fast realtime! insanely good combat good job!The Story, 10/10 Really captivating story with awesome characters you wont get bored for a minute and i am not the kinda guy who will listen to story.Overall its a game you must have! i cant imagine the possibilities in the future, this game has a great base to keep expanding with features and more,  If you love the movies, this is a 100000% must have game

author: Agalloch👻
review: It gives you all the immersion of the Harry Potter universe, both with the setting of Hogwarts, as well as the soundtrack and even the gameplay, with puzzles and minigames, which try to encompass what this universe brings and brings an absurd immersion that few games today nowadays they manage as in the part of the npcs talking in the hall, the ghosts, the talking pictures.It has its negative points, like the optimization that is not at 100%, or sometimes a small rendering bug, but I didn't think it affects the game experience.And it's got that kind of no-nonsense, straightforward gameplay that lets you play a few hours a day if you want, without forgetting a bunch of things you have to do.Before I forget ♥♥♥♥ off Twitter!Update:After the second upgrade the game stopped dropping in performanceNote: 10\10.

As you progress the game just gets more and more features that all have clear love put into them. Easily the best single player game I've experienced in a few years. If you were thinking about buying it and you like the universe, do it.

author: Hyperholyman

author: AdventjX
review: Honestly, the best game I've played in 2023 so far and easy contender for GOTY. When looking at exploration and progression, it might even surpass Elden Ring - and that says a LOT about this game.: As of writing this review, I've completed 54% of in-game challenges + 14/45 achievements. Still have many mechanics to unlock and enjoying every moment of it without being bored.Whoever designed the spell combat in this game deserves a raise. This is Harry Potter done right and truth be told, a game of this caliber should have been made when the Harry Potter hype was at its peak about a decade ago! But better late than never. While combat takes a backseat in this game (as hard as that is to believe; to be elaborated in the next section ), Hogwarts Legacy took every well-done combat system that exists in this day and age of action-adventure games (ie. Assassin's Creed, Arkham series, Dark Souls, etc.) and mashed it into a solid system with its own identity that's difficult to get tired of. My only gripe, if I were to nitpick, is the limitations caused by the spell pages. It's hard to mix up many spells as I would like to and combat may be become clunky, but perhaps a sequel - if any - will provide more options.As mentioned above, even though combat was discussed first, it takes a backseat in this game. Exploration is where this game truly shines and I found myself spending hours and hours just running around Hogwarts/Hogsmeade and doing quests & chores without fighting a single enemy. The idea of unlocking different mechanics and spells in this game that can be creatively utilized not only in combat but in exploration, combined with a progression system designed to help you take things gradually without being overwhelmed, makes every quest and step enjoyable. All in all, here's the best way to put it: I haven't even unlocked the endgame spells and I WANT to put it off so it feels like I'm becoming a truly powerful wizard through every quest and step I take. This game helps you to enjoy the process, not just seek results.Glamour/Transmog (single player or MMOs) is such a simple yet delicate mechanic that can make or break a game. And Hogwarts Legacy hit it out of the ballpark. Not much more to be said. Pick up a gear, have that design unlocked, equip it as your appearance at any time. Do the same for your wand and broom? Couldn't ask for any more than that.Merlin Trials and such may become repetitive, but not to the point of considering them tedious. The Room of Requirement and its vast design potential really caught me off guard and is a welcome addition to the wizard experience. After having experienced Island Sanctuary recently in FF14, the concept of taming animals for resources to upgrade gear and using conjuration stations to grow plants and brew potions was the icing on the cake to an already amazing game.Just like watching a movie, each quest had me engaged to the story and progression and had me waiting for what's coming next. Truly well-written main story and side quests, particularly for anyone like myself playing this game for the nostalgia alone.Haven't confirmed any sources for the Quidditch DLC, but it must be on its way right? It'll be free RIGHT?!Options are slightly lacking in the versatility department, but not a major complaint considering the nature of the game. For an adventure game of this caliber, the options they provided were ENOUGH, but not entirely plentiful as one might expect.With a solid combination of combat + exploration + side content, the trifecta for Hogwarts Legacy is a complete enjoyable experience with replayability potential. Add nostalgia to the formula, and it's the perfect game to play in 2023. Nowadays, that's a hard combination to master. The first game in a while that I pre-ordered for full price and zero regrets. PS: I don't support pre-orders but this game was just too hype lol

author: Alas
review: Hogwarts Legacy made quite a stir on release. The JK Rowling controversy notwithstanding, it looked great and was praised as the Harry Potter game all long-time fans of the franchise were waiting for. I am not such a fan. My attachment to the franchise is rather looser. Yes, I have watched the movies, even liked some of them. I have also visited the exhibition housing the movie version of Hogwarts. But it's not a big or important part of my childhood, as it is for many. Nevertheless, there is some familiarity and I do like a good open-world game from time to time. As such I was eager to try this game. A rare event. Let's see how that went.Arguably the game's greatest selling point is the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry itself. The Castle is lovingly reconstructed and fully explorable. Well, provided you can be bothered to do the fetch quest necessary for the lockpicking spell at least. It is also iconic enough that even people with my limited familiarity will recognise a great deal of locations, items and activities. The rest of the world is also generally beautiful, with some impressive vistas and interesting art direction choices to be seen. Unfortunately, it is just looks. The game offers but limited opportunities to interact with the world. Outside of preset activities/missions you can't really do much. You can't go to classes, or even prank your fellow students. That was a mild disappointment. But still not enough to sully the accomplishment that is Hogwarts.Unfortunately, this is where the good part ends. The game has little else of value to offer. The plot is a D-movie level schlock, unoriginal and entirely unimpressive. Anyone who doesn't guess the direction it's taking at least halfway in is simply not paying any attention to the game. Not that I could fault them for that. The main character is an underdeveloped and overused archetype, a Mary Sue that can do no wrong, even when playing with the Dark Arts, it's all kosher for Mary. The overwhelming majority of the missions are simple fetch quests. In fact, the game offers a masterclass in how many different ways once can masquerade simple fetch quests. The game tries to make up for its lack of interesting content with padding. There is, naturally, an inventory system and other cookie-cutter RPG-lite elements too. Those also serve little purpose and wouldn't have been missed if they weren't there. The setting in general comes with its own set of issues. For instance, the decision to set the game in the 19th century is completely incomprehensible and detrimental. Adding this distance to the timeline effectively eliminates the chance of encountering the more famous canon characters and their relatives. Or hearing of their tales. Which would have allowed even those with a more peripheral association with the franchise to experience some nostalgia, ie from the movies. It makes even less sense if you consider that the game earns nothing from this timeline change. Hogwarts and the wizarding world is effectively stuck in the 19th century anyway. You could have set the game in the 21st century and almost nothing would need to change to accommodate for it. If anything that way even all the ridiculous forced diversity present would make somewhat more sense. Somewhat.Finally, there is combat. Lots and lots of combat. Seeing the bodycount the protagonist racks up I had to keep reminding myself that this is still based on a book for kids. Be that as it may, there are some interesting elements here. The variety of spells present can offer a number of ways to approach a fight. It all works out ok at first, but as you progress through the game and the battles become longer, it hits you. It is tedious. Spam all your spells, wait for them to recharge while avoiding the enemy, rinse and repeat. That's it. Thankfully, there is one specific build that is utterly broken and can be used to end nearly all fights much faster. It requires the use of the Dark Arts though. So if for RP reasons you opt not to go down that path, well sucks to be you. Personally, I'd rather sacrifice every goat I have at the altar of lord Voldemort, than sit through one of those long-winded fights again.All in all, this was a disappointment. I can't really say I hated the game, despite all its flaws, mostly because I couldn't muster enough of an interest to give a dime. For all the noise that surrounded it, it is just a bland open-world experience. One of those where you have a checklist and you just go from place to place on the map gathering collectibles. Granted, the art directors and artists do deserve an Oscar, but everyone else involved is up for a Razzle. Perhaps megafans of the franchise will appreciate the game for what it has to offer, a glimpse of the wizarding world. Still, as far as I'm concerned, Hogwarts Legacy commits the most cardinal of sins. It is boring. As such, not recommended.

author: CyberBunXO
review: First, I am sickened by the usual smear campaign around false social justice and there is no transphobic or antisemitic ANYTHING in this game. And no one who is either of those qualities touched it. It's a sick thing in the media to try and paint anything negatively and they weave tales that suit whatever narrative. SO PLEASE DO NOT take those smear articles into consideration. It's not fair to the game creators at all who DESERVE the love for this game it has warranted. That aside, While the character customization is VERY lacking, and the characters look mostly 30 yrs old once in the game, and wanting to play a feminine pretty wizard or witch is nigh impossible due to the bad character customization, and how it maps the face in game (you always look like you are on drugs and have a stomach ache while smiling literally all the time) the game is still great. It's the best game I've played since Witcher 3, and I am thankful no early access on development, they did the RIGHT thing and waited until they could produce a COMPLETE product, without taking everyone's money for a semi finished product and hype. The game is beautiful, the story is interesting but not overwhelming. The things you can do are setting the bar for future games. I have played 20ish hours and only 20% through the game. It is refreshing to return to a time of polished, unrushed, complete games. I can't give it a 10 because of the characters looking so bad and the lighting on the hair making it look mostly bad if not darker tones, but this is a solid 9/10 from me.

author: Iron Lord Kara
review: This game goes above and beyond expectations. The "relations quest" design is interesting and engaging, provides fun activities to do besides the main quest, and hands you twists and turns that will keep you immersed in every story told throughout the game. 40 hours in, and I'm only done with 50% of the game. The level of spell craft and combo craft in this game is insane. So many combinations to choose from, and allowing you to mix and match spells to make your gameplay experience unique to you.There are builds showing up online, but I have found that there is no "best" or "right way" to get/be strong. With the gear options, every build or spell-focused wizard/witch can reach the top damage numbers with some hard work and dedication.Do I recommend this game? ABSOLUTELY. Avalanche did an amazing job with this game, as it's exactly what I needed.For anyone who is review bombing this game due to J.K. Rowling. Yes, there are royalties that she receives. Yes, she was brought in to help with the game on a few occasions. But, the royalties are small, and the help she garnered was castle/world detail and that is all. Avalanche did a good job with the writing, and put check marks in all the boxes that you put forth for inclusion. Give the game a chance, and remember what it was like watching the movies growing up. Bring a little bit of magic back into your life.

author: Sephiroth
review: Great idea - bad implementation.Pre-ordered this, deluxe edition an all. Game comes out, terrible performance despite my machine vastly exceeding the requirements. Horrible FPS in hallways in the school and just about every cut scene no matter if the graphics are set to Ultra or Minimum. Can't play so I wait. Devs patch the game saying performance should be better. I load the game back up, issues still present. I quit the game. And wait some more. Another patch - performance issues supposedly patched again. Load the game back up once more....still the same issues. I'm done. I returned this game for a full refund. 0/10. I'm not playing this game with the devs.

author: GIAMarcos
review: I guess it is ok. I both love it and hate it as a HP fan. Probably would have recomended it if it didn't crash every 4-30 minutes now. The first ~9 hours were fine, but now it crashes a lot. It feels like it wants to do the world justice, which it does in a lot of cases. But it absolutely doesn't in others.As said by others you don't feel like a Hogwarts student at all. Lessons are very much on the sideline, and only done to get access to some spells and potions. The 'Forbidden Forest' is forbidden, but for some reason you can just go wander into it without any problems. You just have to deal with some spiders and poachers from time to time. The world is gorgeous and Hogwarts itself is massive and you can really get lost there (if you dont use the quest tracker).At the same time it, Hogwarts and to a lesser extend the rest of the world, feels very empty. Yes there are other students and Peeves is doing his usual business but you can barely interact with it. Most of the interaction is meaningless and does not recieve any reaction from others in the same room. You can blast a firespell into a group of students and nothing happens. This makes the game really feel 'on rails'. In the 'Forbidden Forest' you encounter a lot of creatures who do not react to your presence at all! Yesterday I strolled passed a group of Centaurs and they didn't seem to notice me at all. The stuff that is there is very polished and works very well. The combat is fun and engaging. But after a while the things that you cannot do start to bother you. For instance, you can't jump over the railing of a staircase, there are invisible walls everywhere. What year is this? Let me fall to my death by jumping over a railing if I want to. Or at least make the wall look like it is some magic barrier, as if it is a magic protection. Now it just feels lazy.The RPG aspects are a bit shallow (maybe I am spoiled by Skyrim). I don't feel like I have a lot of choice in how to build my character. The gear feels very generic, the talents don't feel like impactfull choices. Just pick the talents for the spells that you use because it straight up upgrades them. I wish the options for combat were more varried. Now it is basically just blast spells. I think a lot more could have been done with potions, herbology, conjuration, transfiguration etc.The more I am thinking about it the more flaws I start to see. I am starting to sound like a salty old man (probably not too far from the truth ;)). But it feels like a game with so much wasted potential! Would probably be a 6.5/10 for me if it wasn't for all the crashes.

Pay no mind to those who hate on it based purely on their own made up BS.I mean I would like to get the stuff the Playstation exclusive stuff as well >:(It's worth your galleons! You will be supporting a very deserving team of developers.

author: Colonel Patrick Sanders
review: Hogwarts Legacy… Where to start? As one of many it has always been my dream to get a good Wizarding World game. I'm a huge fan of the Wizarding World and Harry Potter. From the books, to the movies and everything around it. And with a smile on my face I can say, this game does not disappoint.I went into the game with little expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. Is it perfect? Well no, but it’s everything I ever wanted from a Wizarding World game. Let’s first dive into the good stuff. The best part of this game is easily the world, and most importantly Hogwarts and Hogsmeade. Both are filled with details, things to explore and references to the movies and books. Of the whole world, Hogwarts itself is easily the best. I even dare to say it’s one off, if not the best location ever made in a video game. Everything is just right. It is full of secrets, puzzles, lore, details and things to explore, it’s correct in comparison to the movies and books and it feels alive. It’s just.. Perfect. The beautifully crafted world, together with great graphics and excellent sound design made exploring everything a joy. One of the games where I did not use fast travel the whole time. I would also like to give a little shout out to the devs for introducing seasonal changes. There’s not many Single player games out there that change the ambiance and decoration of the world based on the season.What the game also does right, is distributing content evenly across the length of the campaign/game. Even 20 hours into the game you’re still unlocking new mechanics, spells and locations. This made it not too overwhelming and constantly gave me a feeling there was still so much to do and dive into. I was also pleasantly surprised by how deep some of these (side)mechanics are. Even stuff that can be ignored completely like potion brewing, beast taming etc can go quite in depth.Combat is also much better than I expected. It never becomes repetitive, is challenging at times and enemies having various shields that need to be broken by specific types of spells, together with the player constantly learning new spells keeps it fresh.I’m also really happy they decided to put in something for everyone. From exploration to combat to flying on your broom to beast taming, to potion brewing and even building your room of requirement and various puzzles. There’s something for everyone to like.Now on to the less good points. The main story is rather weak if you ask me. Some side quests/stories are more interesting then the main story itself, and personally for me it just didn’t click. The missions you do are fun, and the locations you visit are great but the overarching story just didn’t do it to me. I also had trouble fitting it in the Wizarding World because the whole plot around which the story revolves has never been mentioned in any of the books/movies or whatever, and the way it’s proposed here, makes me feel it’s important and special enough to have been mentioned.As I said before, the world itself is well-made and fun to explore, and there is something to see around every corner, but for people who don’t care about 100% completion a big part of it is not interesting at all. I personally think they did well by introducing various puzzles, chests and enemy camps around the map. They don’t feel as repetitive as some other open world games, but in the end it is filler content. They should’ve made the main story take place a bit more around the map, but instead it was rather focussed on certain area’s.Also performance is, at the moment of writing, unstable on PC. I have a high end PC, and even though I run the game on 140fps+ most of the time, at times I get frame drops to like 20fps. Especially during combat this is really annoying and it breaks the immersion while exploring.I do think that if you strip the Wizarding World setting from the game, it’s still a good game, but nothing to write home about and in certain aspects quite average. The wizarding world setting and the attention to detail really is what makes this game.Overall, I would highly recommend this game. It’s not perfect but I think that everyone that even remotely likes the wizarding world/harry potter universe will absolutely love this game. Whether you’re a die hard fan, or just like the movies, you will love the references and attention to detail. The world they created, and especially Hogwarts and Hogsmeade are absolutely mind-blowing and set a new bar for developers.

review: Enjoyed This game a lot, i dreamt of having a game like this when i was younger and it really is a lot of fun. However, my experience was ruined when i found out that my choices didn't matter and that the ''evil'' ending literally makes 0 difference since after picking the ending option it just continued on like what i said and did, Didn't happen. I don't recommend this if you wanted a ''real'' Harry Potter RPG, everything is on rails and what you say doesn't matter. it's like playing fallout 4 with magic sticks. but if you like that kinda game where it's basically just let the game force you on it's set path and enjoy the ride, then go ahead. It is really good overall, but after finishing i feel like my fun was taken a dump on and everything i sat through was a waste of time because it wasn't gonna change anything anyway.

author: Infected Ronin
review: Hogwarts Legacy is a MEH game.You want to play a brave Gryffindor, or like me a Slytherin prick? Sure. But it doesn't matter.Choices don't matter in this game. No matter your decisions, the story will unfold the very same way.I guess it would cost too much money to make a story with differents scenario paths based on the house and the choices.So this game has ZERO replay value.Yet the devs made one achievement per house, for reaching a certain point in the game.The Toast of the TownThe Auror's ApprenticeThe Gryffindor in the GraveyardThe Wise OwlThose are 4 Pointless achievements. Devs should have made 1 achievement instead, period.The Alohomora spell is the most tedious thing I have to deal with.Why do I have to deal with this boring mini game for each lock?The tutorial is poorly made, Streamers and I struggled to get the gist of it.It's just an infinite repeat of a big SIGH, I wish you could just disable the mini game, and not waste 1mn each time you have to unlock one of the innumerable locked doors in this game.Do I recommend this game? MEH.Game is good. Fighting is great. Flying is AWESOME!But it feels unfinished.Karma feature, multiple ending based on choices would have made Hogwarts Legacy Game of the year 2023.But you will get the same story, no matter your house, no matter, your choice.So I guess you could say, you decide if I recommend this game or not.

author: Sonaris
review: 7/10The beginning of the game is fascinating and intriguing. Hogwarts and Hogsmeade areas are made with love and attention. But after 30 hours, the game becomes more repetitive and boring (Merlin's trials, dungeons, clearing camps and monsters stays the same). The open world is a redundant part of this game. Also, the creation of potions was disappointing part because you do not participate in this process (a good example of how to do this more interesting is potions craft in Kingdom Come Deliverance).I hope developers will understand their mistakes and maybe will improve it in the future DLCs.P.S. Just want to say thank you for interesting additional quests with your future friends in-game, they are one of the best parts of this game

author: Scardigne
review: PLUG -MOD TO CHANGE TRANS BARMAID TO A MALE - Currently working on a new nexus mod to change the trans barmaid to a male which will be found on the nexus within a weeks time.Don't worry, your kind gestures and awards are saifu with me, I have 21 years in the game design art industry and would love to know your thoughts, as always hope you enjoy the rest of my published mods and I hope you all look forward to the future hogwarts mods.REVIEW -There's still a Potter-esque main story of universe-shaking stakes (one which your fully customisable transfer student inevitably finds themselves at the centre of) but, in a game with over 100 sidequests and dozens more leisurely pastimes, Legacy shines brightest when it leans into emulating the complete Hogwarts experience, sorting hat and all.That's largely thanks to the clear affection (and budget) which Avalanche has poured into its creation of the game's open world, which includes the entire school grounds and surrounding areas such as Hogsmeade and the Forbidden Forest. Whether travelling by foot, broomstick, or Hippogriff, Hogwarts Legacy is an indulgent treat of fantastical tourism for longtime Potterheads, marred only by occasional loading stutters and texture pop-ins that can snap you out of its immersive spell.Much of that fan service will inevitably be lost on series newcomers, of course, but even for those less versed in the wizarding world, Hogwarts Legacy has something to offer. Combat, in particular, successfully adapts the source material's spellcasting into a satisfying battle system that's as much a challenge to your reflexes and tactical skills as it is a spectacle of particle effects and flurrying physics.With over two dozen spells to learn, alongside more advanced actions such as parries and combos, it can be a little overwhelming at first, but – once mastered – Hogwarts Legacy's magical melees showcase both the brutality and the sophistication of wand warfare in a way that the films or books never quite could.This combat pairs nicely with the game’s role-playing progression systems, too, which allow your character to continually evolve across the hundreds of hours you could potentially spend navigating its world. Avalanche generously hands out rewards for your time at Hogwarts, no matter where you might decide to spend it, with a near endless bounty of cosmetic items, talent points, spells, and more to unlock throughout your excursions, both scholarly or otherwise.Not all of this loot holds equal weight or utility, but thankfully it's not the only carrot on the stick to keep you enrolled. The school is nothing without its inhabitants, and the class of 1890 are a rather brilliant bunch, its many pupils a pleasure to spend time with alongside the equally endearing faculty members. Charismatic teachers, such as the scene-stealing charms expert Professor Ronen, will keep you coming back to classes to learn, and there are plenty of other enigmatic figures to encounter, both within the depths of the school's many secret areas and beyond.Voice acting can be a little iffy in places (the male avatar, in particular, comes across as a strange mix of wooden and incredibly posh), and the dialogue doesn't always land — too often dumping lore on the player with reams of exposition — but these blind spots tend to be the exception, rather than the rule. On the flipside, Simon Pegg chews the scenery as uppity Headmaster Phineas Nigellus Black, and the game's soundtrack is fantastic, building off and around John Williams' iconic score rather than overly exploiting it.More broadly, however, Hogwarts Legacy also falls into the same traps as many other big budget, open-world games of its type. With so many avenues for progression, the game can frequently overburden players with convoluted menu management work, as they become weighed down by multiple resource types that bloat out and needlessly complicate the experience.Equally, in a world this big, not every activity feels either important or enjoyable, and there are many spaces that feel unoccupied and lifeless, there for the sake of it rather than to provide any lasting value beyond the surface. Established fans will likely be willing to forgive these more prosaic features, but others may instead come away with the impression of a compromised game not quite able to hold up to the promise of its own ambition.Still, there were plenty of ways in which Hogwarts Legacy could have really botched the spell of delivering on an authentic wizarding power fantasy, especially one burdened by decades of expectations. Thankfully, by resisting the temptations of the live service model (or perhaps avoiding the cautionary tale set by 2020's Marvel's Avengers), Avalanche has conjured up a vision of Hogwarts that – for the most part – looks and feels worthy of its namesake.There may be tension at the seams where it tries to hold the sheer scope of its aspirations together, and its fan service can only do so much to patch over those gaps, but Hogwarts Legacy nonetheless succeeds as an easy – if uneven – time killer. Whether this is your first time to Hogwarts, then, or you already know the way from the Common Room to the Library like the back of your hand, Legacy offers a generous slice of role-playing escapism, not to mention a viable remedy for shaking off those late stage Winter blues.

author: -Yarko
review: This is exactly what we have all been waiting for so long! Rejoice, fans of the Harry Potter universe and welcome to Hogwarts!I've purchased a Deluxe edition, so I had time to evaluate the game from many sides, run around the world, swim in the lake, collect jumping mushrooms, visit battles and start studying dark magic while many were waiting for the official release of the game. - it is incomparable here. Living leaves, grass, living surroundings, waves, paintings. Absolutely everything that caught my eye caused genuine delight. - it's just off the scale! I feel through the screen as if I really am a Hogwarts student. This is one of the few games where I listen to all the conversations of the characters, even if they are talking to each other and not to me. I look at the room, at the team of my faculty, at the world around me and I am absorbed. I didn't have such excitement about games after I passed The Witcher 3.When I'm playing, I want to play even more. "No sleep, I have to see that village over there," and it's every time.The game absorbs, the game captures, the game gives you more and more new each time.  - with animation, of course, they tried. There is a lot of it! Moving chess, paintings (moving not only frames, but also images in them), foliage, grass, clothes. All elements have animation and physics. - let me just say that they delight me. I am amazed and in love. - you know, it's like plunging into real life, where you really do some important things, and not just running around in the form of: find and bring. Everything makes sense here. At least the main quests. They immerse you in the story without any problems, It tells you what is happening and what is needed from you.  - I got the impression that a real person, not a bot, is giving me a task. In conversations with NPCs, you can see their enthusiasm, anxiety, excitement, interest. I would even say that the NPCs here are like real people, yeah, they just perform their algorithm and will not do what you want. Otherwise, they behave like real players. - impressed. I thought for a long time and imagined how it would be implemented. It turned out that it was beyond praise. Again, I will say about the Witcher 3. Very similar emotions from the battle scenes. Spell combinations - you can choose your style of play: go ahead, or act covertly (as far as possible). - A huge number of skins and visual for the main character.• We have been waiting for this game for a very long time• Sometimes the game crashes without any errors. The picture just freezes and that's it, Crashed.Honestly, guys, I'm holding back a lot right now not to reveal all the cards about the game. Among my friends there are both fans of the Harry Potter universe and those who don't like this universe. But I haven't heard from any friend yet that he didn't like the game. We all bought a Deluxe edition and we all have similar emotions. Everyone is delighted.If in doubt about the purchase: watch videos or streams to get an idea.Most likely, I will add some new words in my review when I complete the game by 100%Hello to all Slytherins!

author: Lord Draig Kaiser
review: Despite all the stupid drama surrounding the game due to idiotic fools who can't just let people enjoy something without being hated on. it is very good nothing ground breaking but the game play and story are fun and the world feels like the devs cared about the game and put alot of heart into it,  if you like the world of harry potter you will like the game.You can also pet the cats.

author: Schizoid Fingers
review: Hufflepuff is best house, anyone who says otherwise gets the CRUCIO!Seriously though, the amount of references to the movies and books and the amount of special assets to make it possible are crazy in this game.  Definitively worth a play if you liked either the books or movies. Spell cast fighting was way better than I thought it would be. The only complaint and problem I had was one serious glitch before the transfiguration class. Lost about 20 hours because I was relying on autosaves. Recommend not doing the side quests that pop up while waiting to start the class (or any class for that matter) and just doing the class. Doing so will prevent the glitch.9.3/10

author: General-Mosquito-Spray
review: Absolutely incredible game. Would like to see the game optimized better but to say that the game is unplayable is simply a lie. Running a 3080ti and Im running the game at true 1440p and everything set to ultra and im averaging 60 fps in asset heavy areas. In caves or when Im exploring i get about 100. I was running the game at about 30 to 40 frames with ray tracing on at ultra and at the same settings so I suggest keeping that off. I see frame drops in demanding areas or when loading in a completely new area. People saying this game is literally unplayable are full of it. Unless youre someone that can only play a game at 100+ fps and must play at 4k with everything maxed out with ray tracing on. This is easily one of the best games Ive played in a long while. Theres so much to do and there is so much detail that was put into this game its crazy. Already invested 14 hours into the game and Ive still barely scratched the surface of the story. Highly recommend this game especially if youre a fan of the Harry Potter series. Im not a fanatic by any means but I seeing familiar faces and just seeing parts of the world that was in the films was really fun.

author: Tsuna
review: I know I was sorted into Hufflepuff. But why is that I make so many Slytherin choices? It has an intense and complex ability talent system. It actually respects it's source material. Given it's massive open world, the astonishing level of detail put into every single asset and animation is truly out of this world. The best part is that if you do see a glitch, you might not know if it's just magic doing it's thing. There are a few performance problems that need to be addressed. But at this point it's to be expected with  any major AAA releases like this. As a big fan of the Harry Potter universe, I can't say enough how this game brings to life my childhood dreams of finally getting accepted into Hogwarts and live in a world full of magic.Regarding the drama and the controversy surrounding this game... I just don't care. :)

author: G O R M E Y
review: The fashion is good, the combat is good, the visuals are very good, Hogwarts looks fantastic and I am enjoying the story.However when you do a puzzle or are exploring a dangerous place the player character will make REPEATED comments on the situation and it gets VERY VERY annoying and repetitive. Being told 6 times in a row that I can accio a platform AS I AM ACCIO'ING A PLATFORM or having the character say I shouldn't be here alone when you kill a troll and a group of Ashwinders by yourself is also very annoying.Other than that the game is a 9/10 and I am having alot of fun.

author: jSM2704
review: This is without a doubt the game many of us have waited for, for such a long time. And although the main narrative, especially towards the final moments starts to show cracks in its fassade and the purely gear-based character progression system makes the experience of becoming the witch or wizard of your dreams much less satisfying than it could've been: Hogwards Legacy is a very strong Open World RPG, by far the best Harry Potter based video game ever made and manages to create beautiful and gut-wrenching characters and storylines and to deliver countless of hours of entertainment that you will remember for a long time to come.

author: RavenMad13
review: First, I’ve been truant a lot.  In fact, I haven’t been back to the castle in probably a month of in game time and no one is looking for me.  I don’t have to sneak out, I can wonder all hours of the night, no howlers saying get your butt back to class, and not even my friends are looking for me.  No one misses me at school when I’m meandering the countryside for days on end looking for landing platforms and astronomy tables.  Where is the struggle?  I should have to sneak past prefects and use hidden exits in order to leave the castle at night but alas, those only happen on main quest missions.  Other than that, it’s a free for all.  Second, okay developers what is up with the shadows going crazy all the time.  I have tried playing with all the settings but about an hour after playing the shadows and image layering go haywire.  I have played with settings and everything else, but still weird shadows.  Then I go from human to automaton vocally.  I chose the lower pitch male voice and randomly I sound like a robot.  To fix any of these things I have to completely close out the game and reboot.  Third, there are lots of things to do and at first I was stoked at all the content, but then…I was bored.  It feels like busy work.  There are 3-4 cave designs so once you’ve been down a couple you have been down them all and for very little gain as the gear doesn’t scale to your current level.  Merlin must not have been a clever man because the only challenging puzzle is the cube flipendo one that is more annoying than difficult.  Fourth, poachers and poaching.  So, I can capture a handful of magical creatures so I can harvest their fur, whiskers, and warts to upgrade my gear.  Other than the fact I’m not killing them, am I really any better holding them hostage in my only little menagerie?  I can also breed them and sell them to collectors isn’t that nice?  I must spend 15 minutes grooming and feeding these beasts to get materials which again feels like busy work.  I hate Farmville like timed elements.  Really, if they are giving me a house elf that I can’t free then maybe he should be doing all the feeding and caring and then once a day I can collect the materials from a box?  Then potions, honestly the only one I use is the health potion, because the battles are over before I have exhausted all my spells let alone pulling out a thunder brew.  If I can’t sell potions, then having my own greenhouse in the room of requirement is a waste of time, because I can find all the health potions I need in the world.Fifth, the little things.  I liked having to smack the wings off a key, but I didn’t like after finding everything it was an item that was far below my level so all I really get is a skin.  The prize must match the effort developers.  Scale the gear to level please!  So, here you are walking around at a normal pace in Hogsmeade listening to the sights and sounds enjoying the ambiance, I breeze into the tomes store and wham, I’m now walking like I’m thigh high in the swamps of sadness.  Developers, this is an unnecessary mechanic.  Keep the walking pace the same!  Conversation pace, I wish there was a 2x button because the dialog is slow.  I want to feel engaged enough to listen to their whole rants, but if my eyes can read faster then the pace of the dialog it’s a skip for me.  Speaking of dialog, I would have liked voices that are distinctly goblin and voices that are distinctly dark wizard.  They have variety with so many areas could they have had a distinction with those voices.  No need for a killing curse, because in the end they all die and disappear without ever having to use the killing curse.  If they disappear, they are dead in my book.  Lastly, brooms need stats.  I can’t tell the difference from one to the next, please tell me stats on brooms and why I should bother spending 5k on a broom.In conclusion, not quite sure this game was worth the price for pre-order as I never use my griffin to fly anywhere when a broom works just fine, I think I could have waited until the game was $30.  I wanted to love this game after reading all the books and watching the movies multiple times.  Yet, the more I played the more I became bored.  The side quests of caves, trials, and whatnot all became repetitive and the prizes really didn’t feel worth the effort.  The crafting elements felt unnecessary and I’m a person whose spend 800 hours building settlements in Fallout, so I LOVE building, but I was disinterested in the building mechanics in this game.  The potion crafting felt unnecessary, the beast collecting was another time waster but unfortunately necessary for materials to upgrade.  A game shouldn’t feel like a slog or like work.  I feel this game put in size to make it bigger but, it’s just a lot of time wasting vs. being engaging.Games are meant to be fun or at least have me feeling vested.  The only thing holding me to finish is the fact I paid money for the game.  I don’t even feel a need to do another play-through.  So note to future players, pick the house you want and play how you really want at the beginning because it makes little difference.  You can YouTube all the different endings without the tedium.

author: Mn₂O₇
review: People in school were putting me on a leash and on timer.Also, I've encountered this and now I'm damaged forever:So day two I went into wilderness to kill dark wizards, trolls, spiders and wolves. Don't need your school no more.Came back to school only to get under bad influence of school's caretaker, that made me rob houses, that barely even worth robbing aside of getting him some moons there and here, so it feels like Gladwin got better part of the deal. I wonder why crafting those by timer even a thing in a singleplayer game. Is that some Genshin Impact reference?Identification table is another thing that shouldn't be here. It simply should not exist.

author: Amiga500
review: Let me begin with the fact that I am not a Harry Potter fan. I did not read the books,  I watched the first movies 20 years ago because my girlfriend back then wanted to watch them. I did not care much. I dont remember both, neither the movies nor my ex gf.So I started Hogwarts Legacy and expecteded an average and typical open world game - just embedded into the Potter Lore with some neat stuff and NPCs and the typical quest structure.However, after playing the last days and only having finished the first parts I must admit that Hogwarts Legacy gave me RDR2, Skyrim and Deus Ex flashbacks.I did not anticipate having that much fun.Hogwards Legacy is an extraordinary game with astonishing love to details and so much passion. It is a great open world game, the scale sets the bar for immersion and atmosphere really high. I hope Ubisoft takes notes.Why or how is is so great: It is the exploration, the mechanics and how you interact with everything.The sense of wonder, the pure giddy joy that I get with each and every new quest and location, the choice of which activity I want to spend my current gaming session with, the view, the environment, the scale of this game, everything is so well done. The music fits, the sound fits, the fights are a mix of tactical approaches and pure chaos, I love it. The whole ambiente feels organic, it is an audiovisual masterpiece.All quests and storylines feel good and motivate to explore.  I never really get too invested in the story of a game, unless it's exceptional.And yes Hogwarts Legacy does not invent gaming new or again, but it was is exceptional enough in many segments that I find the story and characters interesting and I get dragged into this world.The last years I didn't think I could feel like this exitement and joy about games anymore, but Hogwarts Legacy has well and truly proven me wrong. Thank you Avalanche, Hogwarts Legacy is proof that games are indeed a work of art.It is a game about "magic" that feels magic in so many moments and left me in awe.This is now a 9 of 10 for me and a must buy and must play for Harry Potter fans. Some criticism:- The inventory management is not good.- Most of the time it runs buttersmooth, but in some areas and moments the fps go wild, I get everything from 120 Ultra Raytracing fps down to 50- despite the amazing world and ambiente you have to do the typical fetch and do this and that quests. Hogwarts Legacy uses the established recipe of open world "go walk and work" quests, so do not expect wonders here game design wise.

author: raixel
review: Its fun. Its minorly buggy. I managed to get myself massively OoB more than once, and have seen some minor graphical glitches. And it has Denuvo. If I had known I wouldnt have bought it. I was wondering why cutscenes ran like crap on High on my beast of a machine. Now I know. ♥♥♥♥ Denuvo. I'm not into Harry Potter at all, and know very little about it. I saw a couple of the movies like 20 years ago and I read one of the books. Comes off like very English "magical" whimsy. I got it because hey, I'm not into Spider Man either and I 100% it on the PS4 because it was that fun. I  had heard about how beautiful this game was, and I'm not seeing it. My machine can handle it on High. Should be able to handle it on Ultra. But frankly, it doesnt look that good even on High, everyones got kind of a wax doll look to them.Its still a fun AAA. And it *is* a typical AAA so expect all the handholding. Ive been playing From Software games lately, so going back I was surprised how easy it is and how everythings perfectly laid out for you and leads you by the nose. But I think thats just games in general nowadays. Still, its cute and fun. Everything is named stuff like Grindleblat and Snorkenplort or weird terms that sound *very* English to a North American. Playing this I can totally see why people got so into the world. Man, if I was 10 years younger I probably would have been into it too when it came out. Its worth a look even if youre not into Harry Potter. If you're OK with Denuvo that is. I'm not. Makes me want to sing yo ho ho and a bottle of rum when publishers put that crap on their games. And I am way not down with piracy. But Im also not down with publishers hamstringing their games for legitimate customers.

review: I am not a Harry Potter fan but this game has me hooked, I can now see that this is how Harry Potter fans feel about their beloved universe.Not once have I felt it a chore to do a quest or whatever, everything I am doing in this game is fun to do, the world is insanely beautiful and animations are very well done then there is combat.To be honest the Devs nailed it, the combat system is awesome it has style and flair is challenging (on the higher difficulties) just having so much fun with this game.To those Harry Potter fans I believe this is the game you have been waiting for, do not let anyone stop you from playing this you may just miss out on the experience you've been waiting all these years for.

author: Echelonia
review: I'm really impressed by this game. I was hoping for a nice open world game and to feel the magic vibes of the Harry Potter universe - but the game is better than I ever thought it would be. I NEVER had perfomance issues and my PC is not even that good tbh ^^ No lags, no freezes. The game looks beautiful and is full of details. It really feels magic and overwhelming on some points. The soundtrack is brilliant! I played the game in German and the translation was perfect. The voice actors did a good job I think :) After around 50 hours in the game I finished the main story line (I did some sidequest in that time, too) and I still have around 40% of sidequests, secrets and so on left to do. Also I think I have to play the story again, at least once more.If you like Harry Potter or the Harry Potter universe, magic, beautiful landscapes, a nice soundtrack and want to play an open world game - this is for you :)

author: H. Grypus
review: I finished the main story of Hogwarts Legacy last night, and wanted to finish it before providing my thoughts.  So, without further adieu, as for as AAA games goes, this one takes the cake (and eats it too).  Most AAA titles have been very disappointing, or lack luster.  They don't try new things, and I think HL sets a standard for that in the gaming community.Story: I loved it.  You're a student, and they don't just "forget" that fact and send you on a journey.  From classess, classmates, professors, and nearby villager problems, the game does a great job in melding and cohesively briing together a world.  Side quests, and companion quests also directly link to the main story, usually, in some way or another, and even those that don't, aren't necessarily bad.Side Quests: On the topic of side quests, thank goodness, there are not 7281 fetch quests.  Sometimes games, especially AAA games, fall into this rabbit hole of "more is better" and HL doesn't.  It spreads the quests out, and most usually have a unique story, or something driving them.  Sure, theres a fetch quest, but they aren't all the same *cough cyberpunk cough*.Side "missions": These are where HL lets us down.  Merlin trials, cairns, popping balloons, these are tedious, and unnecessary.  I'd rather half or even 1/3 of the Merlin trials, with actual complex puzzles.  Do better.Characters: Lovely, just lovely.  Each with a distinct personality, even side characters you meet once or twice are just full of life and vigor.  Love it.  There is one companion who gets shafted, I won't say who, but unfortunate.World: $%^# yes, its beautifully designed, flying is MAGICAL, and I truly mean that.  Magical beasts, plants, its all great.  Even decorating your rooms, the amount of features is astounding.Enemies/combat: While there are few enemies, each enemy has really neat interactions, if you're willing to learn them.  Specific spells that affect them, and ways to disable or deal massive damage.  This, along with the general combat, is fantastic.  More variety would be nice, but I do prefer less variety and quality and I think they made the right choice here.Overall, there are some improvements, but not many to say about this game.  I will, very briefly touch on the controversy and negative comments surrounding this game - don't be a bully and don't harass people and pretend you are better person for it.  Education, awareness, and joining local initiatives helps a lot more than hating someone for playing a game.  Do better.

author: AmirJudak
review: My favorite part is when your character says: "It's over, Ranrok! This is Hogwarts Legacy!"

author: John McClane
review: the game is just fun. super atmospheric and actually everything i wished =) . NO Quidditch tho !!!!!! =(

author: Sephorium
review: This game is incredible! The attention that has been paid to every little detail, the graphics are stunning and the gameplay and combat is phenominal.Pros:- The common rooms are STUNNING, the Hufflepuff common room is my favourite it's so earthy, cozy, hobbity and full of plants! The Slytherin common room is lavish and ornate, a bit cold feeling but beautiful. You can even see the kraken in the lake through the underwater windows sometimes.- There's actually so much space to travel, the area surrounding Hogwarts is all open to fly to and filled to the brim with things to do, Merlin trials, dungeons, chests, secrets.- The entire castle is absolutely gorgeous, the textures of the materials used are also amazing, granite, gold, wood. Incredibly lavish and intricate. - The room of requirement is highly customizable, even down to the ambience of the room, dark and gloomy, bright and cozy.- There is full trasmog built into the game, you keep the appearance of anything picked up and can change the look of any item equipped, for free, at any point. Also the uniform options look awesome.- I wasn't sure how the combat would turn out but it's actually SO GOOD! And the talents you unlock later really make you feel so powerful!Cons: (most are super minor!)- There's some issues with performance but there are fixes out there that work and my game is incredibly stable after them.- You don't really have much reason to go back to the common room, you can't sit on the chairs or sleep to pass time.- Some voice lines are reapeated too often, like the floo network lady and Deek. Like I'm glad you're proud of me but you don't need to tell me 50 times a day you wholesome bugger.9.5/10 childhood dreams come true and absolutely worth the price!
